title: Lead UI/UX Designer - USA
description:
**FoundingTeams.ai** is a new AI Tech Incubator and talent platform. We are supporting the next generation of AI startup founders with the resources they need including engineering, product, sales, marketing, and operations staff to create and launch their products.

The ideal candidate will have a passion for next-generation AI tech startups and working with great global startup talent.

**Job Title:** - Lead UI/UX Designer

**Company**: Stealth AI Startup

**Remote**: 16-20 hours per week.

**Flexible hours :** Yes

**Job Description:**

As a UI (User Interface) Designer, your primary responsibility is to create visually appealing and intuitive interfaces for digital products such as websites, mobile apps, and software applications. You will work closely with cross-functional teams including UX designers, developers, and product managers to ensure the final product meets both user needs and business objectives.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **UI Design:** Designing user interfaces for various digital platforms while adhering to design principles, brand guidelines, and industry best practices.
* **Wireframing and Prototyping:** Creating wireframes and prototypes to illustrate design concepts and interactions, allowing for user testing and iteration.
* **Visual Design:** Developing visually engaging graphics, icons, and other visual elements to enhance the user experience and brand identity.
* **Typography and Color Theory:** Applying typography and color theory principles to create harmonious and readable interfaces that convey the desired mood and message.
* **Responsive Design:** Ensuring designs are responsive and adaptable across different devices and screen sizes for a consistent user experience.
* **Collaboration:** Collaborating with UX designers, developers, and other stakeholders throughout the design process to gather feedback, refine designs, and ensure feasibility of implementation.
* **User Research:** Working closely with UX researchers to understand user needs, behaviors, and preferences, and incorporating findings into design decisions.
* **Usability Testing:** Conducting usability testing sessions or analyzing user feedback to identify areas for improvement and iterate on designs accordingly.
* **Documentation:** Creating design specifications, style guides, and other documentation to facilitate smooth handoffs to development teams and ensure design consistency.
* **Stay Updated:** Keeping abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and design tools to continuously improve skills and stay competitive in the field.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design, Interaction Design, or related field (or equivalent experience).
* Proven experience as a UI Designer or similar role, with a strong portfolio showcasing UI design projects.
* Proficiency in design tools such as Adobe XD, Sketch, Figma, or similar software.
* Solid understanding of design principles, typography, color theory, and visual hierarchy.
* Experience with responsive design and familiarity with front-end development technologies (HTML, CSS, etc.).
* Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to articulate design decisions and incorporate feedback effectively.
* Attention to detail and a passion for creating exceptional user experiences.

**Note:** This job description may vary depending on the specific requirements and preferences of the hiring organization.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Salary: $50,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Junior Designer
description:
Tony Robbins, Robbins Research International is on the hunt for a Junior Designer who's not just looking for a gig but wants to grow, thrive, and be a pivotal part of our expanding family. If you are passionate about transforming ideas into compelling visuals that help transform people’s lives then we want to hear from you!

**Applicants who are looking to be considered must provide a portfolio**

**This opportun**ity is only currently available for US based Candidates


-

**About Us**


**Robbins Research International, led by the iconic Tony Robbins, stands as the global leader in personal development and peak performance strategy.** We are looking for our next Junior Designer to provide high-capacity leverage to our Marketing team. This role will work closely with our Senior Designer to contribute to various design projects across the organization, from conception to execution.

**Who We're Seeking:**


Passion Meets Talent: We're on the lookout for someone who can design with their heart and soul, someone who's obsessed with creating visuals that resonate with our clients and end-users alike.


This role is meant for the rising graphic designer eager to sharpen their skills, elevate their design ability, and find a career home.


We're looking for someone who brings a bold vision for design and is ready to scale new heights in their career while delivering top-notch design assets.


Team Player: Collaboration is key. You'll be working hand-in-hand with our marketing mavens and other creatives, so effective communication and teamwork are non-negotiable.


If you are looking for a team where the speed of execution meets collaboration, all with the thrill of an agency and the solid ground of corporate stability, we’d love to hear from you!

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Work closely with the Senior Designer and Marketing team to conceptualize, design, and implement creative solutions for marketing initiatives, events, product launches, and other departments.
* Assist in maintaining and enhancing the visual identity of the Tony Robbins brand across various mediums, including video/motion graphics.
* Help maintain an organized file management system, including archiving and labeling assets.
* Ensure designs adhere to brand guidelines and production standards, while also contributing insights into design principles.
* Develop collateral, presentations, web graphics, landing pages, and other promotional materials.
* Contribute to the enhancement of social media presence through engaging visual content.
* Work closely with internal stakeholders, coordinate with different departments to understand project requirements, gather necessary information and assets for content production, and deliver projects on time.

**REQUIREMENTS**

* You must have a strong portfolio that shows your true talents, and top-notch designs that wow and impress
* You must have jaw dropping experience with the Adobe design suite (PhotoShop, XD, Figma, InDesign, etc.) & basic UI concepts
* You must have an awesome, low-ego attitude and be truly excited about design
* You must stay updated on design trends and have a true heart for collaboration, share ideas, and brainstorms how to take your design to the next level
* You must be able to work quickly, on-the-fly, with tight deadlines, multiple projects, and submit world-class quality work.
* Ability to work remotely full-time during regular business hours.
* Understanding of visual elements (layout, type, and fonts)

**Application Instructions**


Send us your portfolio, resume, and a brief introduction on WHY you are interested in joining the team at Tony Robbins to


StepUpNow@TonyRobbins.com. Mention: “Your Next Marketing Graphic Designer, Behance - [NAME]" in the subject line.


This is a full time, W-2 position and full benefits. Starting Compensation begins in the $50-60k range the potential to grow based on merit and performance.

*See you in our inbox!*

title: Web Designer / UIUX Designer
description:
Our ideal Web Designer is a self-starter with a knack for crafting custom websites and delivering unique digital experiences across desktop and mobile platforms. With expertise spanning from simple website layouts to intricate UI/UX designs and interactive web experiences, Web Designers at Designity play a pivotal role in bringing client visions to life.


The Designity Creative Community is made up of Creatives at all levels of experience. We are looking for both talented new designers and seasoned professionals who thrive in a collaborative environment. You will collaborate closely with Creative Directors who engage directly with clients - enabling you to focus on design.


Take your talents and skills to the next level using your imagination and creativity! Enjoy the freedom and flexibility of freelancing without the “hustle” when you join the Designity Creative Community.


Designity is a subscription-based (https://www.designity.com/pricing) collaborative creative platform that enables creatives and businesses to collaborate more effectively through unique and innovative model (https://www.designity.com/). This collaborative approach has convinced both small and large companies, including Calendly, Kung Fu Tea, and Marriott Hotels, to use Designity for their design and marketing efforts instead of traditional, costly, and inefficient alternatives.


We are transforming the creative industry, moving away from outdated and ineffective marketing and design methods (https://www.designity.com/compare). Companies typically hire in-house designers, which is costly, time-consuming, skill-limiting, and requires substantial supervision. Working with traditional design and marketing agencies offers an alternative but at a high cost. Marketplaces like Upwork and Fiverr claim to offer a more affordable solution, but their model lacks reliability and optimization for creative services, causing frustration for businesses.


While we still operate like a startup (it can get very fast-paced at times) we are in full scale- up mode. If you are looking for a clear career growth plan, fully remote work, flexible hours, the opportunity to work a variety of projects, and quality content for your portfolio, Designity is the place for you to learn, develop, and grow into the creative thought leader that you've always wanted to be.


**RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Create original website/app design concepts as well as unique user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) that are visually interesting and on brand.
* Manage the creative process from concept to completion by using a range of skills including wireframes, information architecture, design concepts, accessibility, and responsive designs.
* Create interactive and effective wire-frames for custom websites (ecommerce or marketing websites) to visually communicate the concepts.
* Build websites through CMS platforms such as Wordpress, Webflow, Shopify, Wix, and more as needed from time to time.
* Consistently create well-designed, tested consumer experiences while using debugging techniques to troubleshoot technical issues.
* Complete high-quality and on schedule design projects for clients across a variety of industries.
* Collaborate with Creative Directors and other members of the Creative Community to ideate, develop designs, and implement changes based on feedback.
* Maintains technical knowledge by attending design workshops; reviewing professional publications; and participating in professional events.


**QUALIFICATIONS:**


* You have experience in designing web/app design ranging from 1 year as an Emerging Creative to 10 plus years as a Professional Creative.
* Knowledge of web and mobile design as well as UI/UX best practices and emerging technologies.
* Proficient in the use of design and prototyping software (Adobe Creative Suite, specifically XD for website design).
* Advanced skills in creating wireframes, designing mobile applications, landing pages, and interactive sites, QA testing experience, working with various interfaces, and familiarity with UX/UI design principles.
* You are comfortable working with CMS platforms such as WordPress and Shopify.
* Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript is not required but it's a big plus.
* A passion for new technologies such as Web 3.0, NFTs, and VR is a big plus.
* You are organized, stick to your deadlines, and deliver pixel-perfect designs with an entrepreneurial mindset.
* You are well-versed in the design process and methodologies and willing to grow into a thought leader in our community.
* You're able to create initial designs with limited input from Creative Directors and proactively request feedback to make necessary updates and revisions.
* Located in the US or Canada with strong verbal and written communication skills in English.


**Additional Information:**


* Fully remote - Opportunity to work as a 1099 freelancer or full-time employee.
* 401(k) and health insurance benefits after 3 months as a W-2 employee.
* Flexible paid vacations, company holidays, and mental health days for all W-2 employees.
* Flexible hours within the USA and Canada.
* Opportunity to expand your portfolio with unique projects.
* “No Meetings Monday's, and Wednesday's”


‍
*At Designity, all employment decisions are based on business needs, qualifications, and merit. Designity is an Equal Opportunity Employer. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. We believe that a workforce diverse in cultures, perspectives, skills, and experiences will benefit our team, clients, and products.*


**Creative Disclaimer:**


*In order to be considered for this position, it is required that you include a portfolio of your relevant work and any specific projects as requested in the application. Without these materials, your application will not be reviewed.*


*Compensation is based on experience level: $36,000 - $80,000 + bonus*

title: Graphic Designer (USA) - [MKT102B]
description:
Overview:
**Who we are—**  

Transcat is a dynamic, innovative, growing company that has been recognized as the leading calibration and compliance services provider in North America and beyond. With over 1,000 employees—in technical, consulting, operational, sales, finance, and corporate roles—we have stood the test of time by delivering on our Trust in Every Measure promise to our customers in vital industries, including life sciences, aerospace, defense, energy, and utilities. We fulfill this promise through our employees, who live Our Values every day, the Transcat Way. Our employees are at the center of the rewarding, challenging, and life-changing work we do for our customers and those they serve. Are you ready to join a company where the work you do makes a difference, and where you can grow in your career?  

**Here’s what Transcat has to offer—*** Work that matters.
* A values-based culture where people care about each other and the work they do together.
* Flexibility
* Training and development to accelerate learning and career advancement.
* Competitive compensation and benefits, including paid time off, health insurance, tuition reimbursement, retirement, stock purchase plan, and MORE!


The graphic designer collaborates with the Marketing team and participates in the planning and execution of the visual and website component of marketing efforts, promoting and strengthening the Transcat brand. This position works on a variety of projects, including web (eCommerce), print, digital, and branding initiatives. The graphic designer translates our brand and value into visually stimulating and engaging designs. This role spans across the organization, supporting various departments with a wide range of design collateral.
Responsibilities:
* Create, design, and execute materials that effectively communicate Transcat’s brand identity, including, but not limited to:
	+ Website CMS page creation
	+ Digital/Print marketing collateral
	+ Website creative assets
	+ Email graphics
	+ Social and media ads
	+ Print catalog design and production
	+ Vehicle graphics
	+ Signage (indoor and outdoor)
* Work on day-to-day web, digital, and print requests and ongoing initiatives for the marketing team and other departments/business units across the organization.
* Assist with the printing process of all collateral, whether in-house or through a third-party vendor. Prepare print-ready files and monitor quotes and invoices for accuracy.
* Execute print and digital projects within budget and on time; identify opportunities to improve the creative process to increase efficiency and turnaround time.
* Coordinate and execute website promotions, ensuring all assets are deployed at launch.
* Complete other projects, tasks, initiatives, and duties, as assigned.


Qualifications:
**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities*** Portfolio demonstrating a range of creative projects (web and print)
* Understanding of standards and best practices for digital creative assets and print
* Familiarity with HTML and CSS is preferred
* Ability to work in a fast-paced production environment
* Meticulous organization and time management skills; ability to manage and prioritize multiple requests to meet deadlines
* Advanced interpersonal and communication skills; ability to effectively communicate and present concepts and designs to various departments, team members, and leadership
* Self-motivated with a positive, collaborative attitude with a passion for visual communications and the ability to thrive in a multidisciplinary team
* Excellent writing and proofreading skills strongly preferred
* Proficient in Adobe InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, Acrobat; PowerPoint/MS Office experience is a plus
* Experience in eCommerce UI/UX design is preferred
* Wordpress CMS platform experience is a plus
* Magento eCommerce platform experience is a plus
* Experience working with print vendors on production and distribution of high-volume print material
* Monday.com or other PM software experience preferred

**Education and Experience:*** Minimum 3 years graphic design experience in a professional setting
* Bachelor's Degree in graphic design or related field preferred

 **Physical Demands**The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.* Sit for extended periods of time and maintain concentration for prolonged periods of work.
* Use a computer for extended periods to type, operate a mouse, and perform other tasks.
* Communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, with colleagues, clients, and vendors.
* Stand, walk, and move around the office as necessary to meet job requirements and attend meetings.
* Lift and move objects or equipment weighing up to 25 pounds on an occasional basis.

 **Work Environment**The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. **Equal Opportunity and Non-Discrimination**
Transcat is an equal-opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination on the basis of any protected status. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, creed, disability, domestic violence victim status, gender identity, genetic predisposition or carrier status, marital status, national origin, pregnancy, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, status as a protected veteran or as a member of any other protected group or activity.  

We will make reasonable accommodations for personnel with disabilities to enable them to perform the essential functions of this position unless doing so poses an undue hardship on the company or a direct threat to health or safety.

title: Sr. Motion Graphics Designer & Video Editor
description:
Apollo.io is the leading go-to-market solution for revenue teams, trusted by over 500,000 companies and millions of users globally, from rapidly growing startups to some of the world's largest enterprises. Apollo.io provides sales and marketing teams with easy access to verified contact data for over 270 million B2B contacts, along with tools to engage and convert these contacts in one unified platform. By helping revenue professionals find the most accurate contact information and automating the outreach process, Apollo.io turns prospects into customers. Apollo raised a series D in 2023 and is backed by top-tier investors, including Sequoia Capital, Bain Capital Ventures, and more, and counts the former President and COO of Hubspot, JD Sherman, among its board members. Apollo.io is growing rapidly, with 900% revenue growth since 2021, and is looking for world-class talent to keep building with us.


Apollo is looking for a world-class Sr. Motion Graphics Designer & Video Producer to join our in-house video team.



In this role, you’ll uplevel the quality of our video content with your mastery of post-production, including motion design, animation, editing, sound, and more.



As a top-notch motion designer and animator, you’ll distill complex subjects into simple, easy-to-understand visuals that make each video 10x more effective, or create mind-blowingly gorgeous animations for high profile ads and hype videos — and know which treatment to apply on any given project.
  

  

As a video producer, you’ll oversee the end-to-end production of some of our highest-profile video content, including Apollo Academy courses, in-product videos, customer stories, marketing assets, ads, Olympus keynotes, explainers, and more.



You’ll work alongside an extraordinary team of videographers, content creators, designers and marketers to produce videos that drive results for Apollo and our customers.



This role reports to the Head of Video. The ideal candidate for this position has an extraordinary portfolio of video content, is an exceptional visual thinker and collaborator (bonus points for being able to storyboard quickly in analog mediums), has a background in UI/UX design (Figma experience preferred), and has worked at a fast-growing technology company before.


**Responsibilities:**


* Create and apply world-class design and motion to Apollo’s video content to make every video you touch 10x more effective
* Oversee the end-to-end production and project management of video campaigns, including for ads, keynote speeches, product hype videos, Apollo Academy content and more
* Transform raw video footage into compelling stories through creative editing, color grading, and sound design/mixing
* Scope new video projects and keep stakeholders informed as projects progress
* Appropriately allocate and scale your time on various projects from quick turn to high touch and in-between


This role is fully remote (ideally located in the US) and will require occasional travel.


**Qualifications:**


* A portfolio of extraordinary video content, with tangible business results attributed to your work
* 10+ years of experience in design, motion design, and video production, preferably in a fast-paced startup environment
* You’re a clear, efficient communicator, highly organized, and have the ability to manage multiple projects at once
* Your portfolio contains animated software product ads, explainers and demos, including UI animations
* Your portfolio contains Figma and Adobe Illustrator designs you made that are consistent with brand guidelines
* Your portfolio contains Figma and Adobe Illustrator designs you made and turned into world-class motion graphics
* Mastery of Adobe After Effects
* Mastery of Adobe Premiere

  


**About Apollo.io**



Founded in 2015, Apollo.io is one of the leading sales intelligence and engagement platforms trusted by over 15,000 paying customers, from rapidly growing startups to some of the largest global enterprises. Our community-based approach to crowdsourcing data gives users maximum coverage while ensuring data accuracy. Our advanced algorithms and unique data acquisition methods help over 500,000 sales professionals enrich and analyze prospects’ data to increase quality conversations and opportunities.



We have notable investors: Sequoia, Y Combinator, Tribe Capital, and Nexus Venture Partners. We recently completed a Series C financing to fuel our next growth phase. The round was led by Sequoia Capital, with participation from Tribe Capital, NewView Capital, and Nexus Venture Partners.



Our growth and customer feedback set us apart from competitors. Apollo.io had over one million sign-ups for its platform in the past year, and the number of weekly active users increased by over 400%. We are a top-ranking G2 Crowd vendor in the Sales Intelligence, Lead Intelligence, Marketing Account Intelligence, and Sales Engagement categories. Our highest scores are in the B2B data space for accuracy and ROI based on customer reviews.


**What You’ll Love About Apollo**



Besides the great compensation package and culture that thrives in openness and excellence, we invest tremendous effort into developing our remote employees’ careers. The team embraces that we have a sole purpose: to help customers maximize their full revenue potential on the Apollo platform. This mindset opens us up to a lot of creative approaches to making customers successful at scale. You’ll be a significant part of a lean, remote team, empowered to really own your role as a proactive educator. We’re very collaborative at Apollo, so you’ll be able to lean on your teammates, even in adjacent departments, to help you achieve lofty goals. You’ll be supported and encouraged to experiment and take educated risks that lead to big wins. And, you’ll have a whole team remotely by your side to help you do it!

title: Graphical User Interface Designer
description:
cFocus Software seeks a Graphical User Interface Designer to join our program supporting the US Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), Office of the Inspector General. This is a fully remote position. This position requires an active Public Trust clearance and must meet 8570 requirements.  

  

**Qualifications:*** Degree in Computer Science or related field and masters preferred.
* Active Public Trust Clearance
* 8570 Compliant (Security+ CE)
* 5+ years of experience with ServiceNow, AWS, etc.
* 5+ years of experience working with Cloud Solutions and PaaS platforms.
* 5+ years of experience working with UI/UX design.

  

**Duties:*** Provide configuration, customization, and modernization services to assist the OIG in integrating identified systems.
* Provide architecture, design, and modernization services as identified and directed by the COR.
* Coordinate project support with the COR and any OIG designated stakeholders.
* Participate in requirement analysis planning in support of the migration and integration of current legacy systems.
* Examine systems for the purpose of achieving long term, full-scale integration required for the Government.
* Develop options for process improvement and develop tools as directed to support analyses.
* Develop data models from existing application software and across functional domains for the purpose of designing standard/common/ migration systems.
* Evaluate process models within a functional area to facilitate data model development and data integration.
* Participate in the development of data migration strategies to identify the plans and processes for the transition of current legacy data.
* Review and analyze the implementation and migration of new technologies and develop recommendations for supporting the integration into an integrated application architecture.

title: iOS Developer
description:
The Mobile Specialist participates in project planning, including resource estimation, and in the creation and review of technical deliverables. The Mobile Specialist works in conjunction with other technical team members in all phases of the Agile Scrum SDLC.

This position will participate as a key technical position for DEP’s mobile inspection applications. The mobile inspection applications are being built on an iOS platform. The resulting data is received into DEP’s enterprise system via services. The backend database is Oracle 19C. This position will be responsible for serving as the designer, developer and/or engineer on multiple mobile inspection applications. They will work with the end user stakeholders at times, various Business Analysts (BAs) and Project Managers (PMs), and other technical staff in defining and managing the business and technical requirements. The candidate will be responsible for developing and/or engineering a user interface, a service tier, data tier components, and/or infrastructure or security for the mobile projects by working with the team leads.

Attention to reusable components and repeatable processes is required for developing the iOS solutions utilizing, but not limited to, Objective C, Swift, JSON, XML, and consumption of RESTful web services. The candidate will develop applications that link to a web service-oriented backend solution.

Additionally, a solid understanding and experience in Apple’s technologies is required, including but not limited to the distribution of certificates, provisioning profiles, code signing, keychains, push notifications, app transport requirements, and iOS version histories. The candidate should have a strong knowledge of iOS frameworks related to UI, Core Data, storyboards, web services, security/keychain, camera integration, asynchronous/background processing, multitasking, etc. Also, a strong understanding of MVC, delegation, target-action and Cocoa layers related to Touch, Media, OS and Services and Objective/C and iOS principles of memory management, notifications, blocks, categories, etc. is strongly helpful.

The ideal candidate will assist in project planning, including the development of timelines. They must understand Agile Scrum methodology and participate in daily standups. The selected candidate is expected to assist in the development and review of technical deliverables on the projects.

**Required/Desired Skills:**

Required - 6yrs - Full SDLC experience as an application developer

Required - 5yrs - Experience with object-oriented development

Required - 5yrs - Experience with iOS SDK and Objective-C

Required - 5yrs - Familiarity with Swift programming language and latest iOS APIs and frameworks

Required - 5yrs - Experience with Core Data framework

Required - 5yrs - Experience with relational database design and development

Required - 4yrs - Experience with iOS Auto Layout, Storyboard, Blocks and GCD

Required - 2yrs - Experience in architecting & solutioning mobile apps that consumes web services

**Desired Skills:**

Highly desired - 5yrs - Experience with deploying iOS apps

Highly desired - 1yrs - Experience in a team leadership position

Highly desired - 1yrs - Experience with deploying enterprise iOS apps via MDM

Highly desired - 5yrs - Experience with HTML5 development and JavaScript frameworks

Highly desired - 2yrs - Experience with Java centric server-side development and solutioning

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: From $70.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance

Compensation package:

* Hourly pay
* Performance bonus

Experience level:

* 5 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* iOS: 5 years (Preferred)
* Mobile Development: 5 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Senior Software Engineer (Android), Invoices
description:
**Company Description**
-----------------------


Since we opened our doors in 2009, the world of commerce has evolved immensely, and so has Square. After enabling anyone to take payments and never miss a sale, we saw sellers stymied by disparate, outmoded products and tools that wouldn’t work together.  

  

So we expanded into software and started building integrated, omnichannel solutions – to help sellers sell online, manage inventory, offer buy now, pay later functionality through Afterpay, book appointments, engage loyal buyers, and hire and pay staff. Across it all, we’ve embedded financial services tools at the point of sale, so merchants can access a business loan and manage their cash flow in one place. Afterpay furthers our goal to provide omnichannel tools that unlock meaningful value and growth, enabling sellers to capture the next generation shopper, increase order sizes, and compete at a larger scale.  

  

Today, we are a partner to sellers of all sizes – large, enterprise-scale businesses with complex operations, sellers just starting, as well as merchants who began selling with Square and have grown larger over time. As our sellers grow, so do our solutions. There is a massive opportunity in front of us. We’re building a significant, meaningful, and lasting business, and we are helping sellers worldwide do the same.**Job Description**
-------------------


Square Invoices is the easiest way for merchants to close sales and collect payments remotely. Our customers rely on our products because they are well-designed, easy to use, and integrated with their business. We are a full-stack product oriented team, spanning across engineering, design, product, data science, and marketing. You’ll contribute to the roadmap and strategy decisions and will play a critical role in helping the team accomplish our industry-leading growth goals.


On the Invoices Front Door team, we focus on supporting advanced workflows for upmarket sellers who tend to have a longer sales lifecycle compared to in person sales. Invoices is unique to Square in that we can flex our products to be used complementary to sellers main point of sale, or serve as a complete business and payments stack solution. Our team is focused, fast-moving, and rapidly growing with an abundance of growth and impact opportunities. We focus on building the best tools to help our merchants close sales and get paid quickly. We are doing this in an efficient and scalable way, by automating critical functions for our merchants.

**https://squareup.com/**

**You will:**

* Collaborate closely with engineers, designers, and product managers to design, build, and iterate on world-class product experiences, defining product scope and design.
* Be responsible for the entirety of your features; including API design, implementation, automated testing, and rollout.
* Hold yourself, and your teammates accountable to the standards of engineering and ethics that enables Square to safely move billions of dollars in payments and allow our customers to trust us with their sensitive data.
* Help empower a team of engineers by mentoring individuals, cultivating pragmatic engineering decision-making, and leveraging your technical expertise to constantly raise the quality of design decisions and implementation by holding the team to a high standard.
* Partner with Web, iOS, Android, and Server engineers to ship features.
* Respond to customer feedback to improve our products.
**Qualifications**
------------------

**You have:**

* 5+ years experience developing and shipping Android applications using Java/Kotlin
* Strong ownership and execution skills, to deliver remarkable solutions to our merchants.
* The ability to adapt to the different stages of product development. This can mean building intentionally scrappy code to iterate quickly, or building a sustainable system that will support our product for years to come.
* Demonstrated ability to create readable, pragmatic code
* The ability to provide technical mentorship and guidance to engineers of varying experience levels.
* Strong communication skills and a demonstrated ability to work cross-functionally with other functions, such as designers, product managers, data scientists, marketing, and business development to deliver a great product
* An appreciation for the connection between the software you build and the experience it delivers to customers

**Technologies we use and teach:**

* Kotlin for development, leveraging Square’s modern open source library, Workflow
* Espresso UI for testing
* Protocol buffers for network transport
* Gradle for our build environment
* Dagger, leveraging Square’s open source library, Anvil, to simplify dependency injection
* Compose, LeakCanary, Kotlin Coroutines, OkHTTP and more
**Additional Information**
--------------------------


Block takes a market-based approach to pay, and pay may vary depending on your location. U.S locations are categorized into one of four zones based on a cost of labor index for that geographic area. The successful candidate’s starting pay will be determined based on job-related skills, experience, qualifications, work location, and market conditions. These ranges may be modified in the future.  

  

Zone A: USD $148,700 - USD $223,100  

Zone B: USD $141,300 - USD $211,900  

Zone C: USD $133,800 - USD $200,800  

Zone D: USD $126,400 - USD $189,600


To find a location’s zone designation, please refer to this resource. If a location of interest is not listed, please speak with a recruiter for additional information.


Full-time employee benefits include the following:

* Healthcare coverage (Medical, Vision and Dental insurance)
* Health Savings Account and Flexible Spending Account
* Retirement Plans including company match
* Employee Stock Purchase Program
* Wellness programs, including access to mental health, 1:1 financial planners, and a monthly wellness allowance
* Paid parental and caregiving leave
* Paid time off (including 12 paid holidays)
* Paid sick leave (1 hour per 26 hours worked (max 80 hours per calendar year to the extent legally permissible) for non-exempt employees and covered by our Flexible Time Off policy for exempt employees)
* Learning and Development resources
* Paid Life insurance, AD&D, and disability benefits


These benefits are further detailed in Block's policies. This role is also eligible to participate in Block's equity plan subject to the terms of the applicable plans and policies, and may be eligible for a sign-on bonus. Sales roles may be eligible to participate in a commission plan subject to the terms of the applicable plans and policies. Pay and benefits are subject to change at any time, consistent with the terms of any applicable compensation or benefit plans.

title: Principal Accessibility Software Engineer
description:
Join us as we pursue our exciting vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers.

At Splunk, we believe making machine data accessible, valuable, and usable is essential to creating inclusive products for our customers. Accessible design in our physical world benefits everyone; we’ve all used sidewalk cutouts or sent text messages. We’re bringing that same philosophy into our digital products by making digital accessibility a priority at Splunk.
It’s crucial to consider all customers in our product suite, including those with permanent, temporary, and situational disabilities. By not considering digital accessibility, we prevent professionals with disabilities from becoming advocates of Splunk.

Join our Product Experience team as we look to scale our digital accessibility program! As a **Principal Accessibility Software Engineer**, your role will be crucial to growing the efficacy of our digital accessibility program. This role will work closely with our Accessibility Program Manager, Designers, and other cross-functional Engineering teams to set the direction for solving accessibility challenges across all of Splunk’s user experience products.
This role requires in-depth knowledge of web accessibility, cross-functional relationship building, and a clear understanding of the standards, and policies that govern web accessibility both in the US and globally.**What you’ll do**
------------------

* Help modernize the UI development across all of Splunk
* Set the standards for accessibility development across Splunk
* Collaborate closely with Product, Design, and Engineering teams to advise and implement holistic web accessibility solutions across multiple products
* Lead in setting the direction for CI/CD development across multiple product pipelines
* Prioritize backlogs, support test automation improvements, validate fixes
* Provide training to empower teams to own web accessibility quality
* Mentor and coach other engineers, share the work you are doing, and participate in code reviews
* Evolve the maturity of Splunk’s accessibility program to reach new KPIs and metrics

**What you'll need**
--------------------

* 12+ years of experience working with web and/or client-side technologies
* Advanced skills in HTML, CSS, Javascript, React
* Experience in accessibility standard methodologies, WCAG standards, VPAT compliance, and a strong awareness of assistive technologies
* Experience working with Design Systems and shared components across multiple teams
* Experience with Accessibility Tools (JAWS, NVDA, Axe)
* Knowledge of browser internals like Javascript engines, native DOM, Event APIs, browser quirks and ways to tune code to enhance web accessibility and performance
* Comfort with command-line applications, source control, testing frameworks, continuous integration and other aspects of developing in large, distributed software teams across multiple codebases
* Ability to lead engineering teams and set technical direction
* Proven track record for establishing strong coding principles through code reviews and design sessions
* Ability to collaborate, build partnerships, and communicate efficiently across teams
* Excellent problem solving and analytical thinking skills

**Preferred Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:**
---------------------------------------------

* Experience with Backbone.js development is highly desirable
* Background in testing and validation of websites for Accessibility Compliance
* International Association of Accessibility Professionals (IAAP) Web Accessibility Specialist (WAS) Certification, JAWS Certification
* Agile development experience using tracking software such as JIRA

**Education:**
--------------

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent training and work experience.


Splunk is an Equal Opportunity Employer: At Splunk, we believe creating a culture of belonging isn’t just the right thing to do; it’s also the smart thing. We prioritize diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging to ensure our employees are supported to bring their best, most authentic selves to work where they can thrive. Qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, age, physical or mental disability or medical condition, genetic information, veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws. We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.
Note:

**Base Pay Range**


SF Bay Area, Seattle Metro, and New York City Metro Area


Base Pay Range: $192,000.00 - 264,000.00 per year


California (excludes SF Bay Area), Washington (excludes Seattle Metro), Washington DC Metro, and Massachusetts


Base Pay Range: $172,000.00 - 236,500.00 per year


All other cities and states excluding California, Washington, Massachusetts, New York City Metro Area and Washington DC Metro Area.


Base Pay Range: $156,000.00 - 214,500.00 per year


Splunk provides flexibility and choice in the working arrangement for most roles, including remote and/or in-office roles. We have a market-based pay structure which varies by location. Please note that the base pay range is a guideline and for candidates who receive an offer, the base pay will vary based on factors such as work location as set out above, as well as the knowledge, skills and experience of the candidate. **In addition to base pay, this role is eligible for incentive compensation and may be eligible for equity or long-term cash awards.**


Benefits are an important part of Splunk's Total Rewards package. This role is eligible for a competitive benefits package which includes medical, dental, vision, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off and much more! Learn more about our comprehensive benefits and wellbeing offering at https://splunkbenefits.com.

title: Senior Software Developer, CX Billing and Self Service
description:
Do you have a passion for elegant solutions to complex problems? Are you into the details? Want to work on mission critical customer facing systems that a are top enterprise priority? Want to make a difference in the day-to-day life of customers by saving them time? We are reimagining the billing and payment customer experience and evolving the MyIDEXX platform to new heights. This is your chance to become part of our growing team of creative and talented individuals who are passionate about the customer experience.
  
  

As an experienced Software Developer, you will be a key member of the team, contributing to the design and development of new features and enhancements that will be used by thousands of customers . Our team is small and fast moving so you should be as comfortable designing a new feature as you are writing and debugging code. You will work with a closely knit team of developers, analysts, designers, product managers and testers so excellent communication and interpersonal skills are a must.
  
  

The ideal candidate will have a solid background in JavaScript development with an emphasis on the full web application stack and a solid understanding from the database to the web UI. Using the latest technologies means you must be willing to continuously learn new things.
  
  

**In this role:**  

Develop, test and maintain system functionality based on agile user stories
  
Utilize the latest technologies such as React and Node.js
  
Leverage and maintain a modern, secure, serverless AWS cloud hosted platform
  
Troubleshoot and debug issues that arise
  
Maintaining technical documentation
  
Stay current and utilize the latest development tools and best practices
  
  

**What you will need to succeed:**  

5+ years of relevant technical development work experience
  
Must have experience with JavaScript, full web application stack
  
Solid understanding from the database to the web UI
  
Experience with Amazon Web Services
  
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  
Ability to think and act both strategically and tactically
  
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team
  
Strong analytical and multitasking skills
  
Curiosity and a strong desire to learn and grow your technical skillset
  
Experience working on a cross functional Agile Scrum team
  
  

**Nice to have:**  

Experience with SQL databases
  
Experience with Datadog, AWS Cloudwatch, or similar application / infrastructure monitoring tools
  
Experience with GitHub, AWS CodePipeline, or similar CI/CD tools
  
  

Why IDEXX?
  
We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. An innovation leader in every industry we serve, we follow our Purpose and Guiding Principles to help pet owners worldwide keep their companion animals healthy and happy, to ensure safe drinking water for billions, and to help farmers protect livestock and poultry from diseases. We have customers in over 175 countries and a global workforce of over 10,000 talented people.
  
  

So, what does that mean for you? We enrich the livelihoods of our employees with a positive and respectful work culture that embraces challenges and encourages learning and discovery. At IDEXX, you will be supported by competitive compensation, incentives, and benefits while enjoying purposeful work that drives improvement.
  
  

Let’s pursue what matters together.
  
  

IDEXX values a diverse workforce and workplace and strongly encourages women, people of color, LGBTQ+ individuals, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, and veterans to apply.
  
  

IDEXX is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will not be discriminated against because of race, color, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, religion, national origin, citizenship status, disability, ancestry, marital status, veteran status, medical condition, or any protected category prohibited by local, state, or federal laws.
  
  

**What you can expect from us:**  

* Base annual salary target: $100,000 - $125,000 (yes, we do have flexibility if needed)
* Opportunity for annual cash bonus
* Health / Dental / Vision Benefits Day-One
* 5% matching 401k
* Additional benefits including but not limited to financial support, pet insurance, mental health resources, volunteer paid days off, employee stock program, foundation donation matching, and much more!


#LI-REMOTE

title: Lead SaaS Product Designer - Remote US
description:
**The Opportunity:**
--------------------



At Seamless.AI, we are on a mission to 10X the user experience and engagement of our sales platform, making the journey from onboarding to increased usage and revenue expansion a breeze for all of our users. We are in search of an experienced **Lead SaaS Product Designer** who thrives in crafting visually stunning, easy to use, highly intuitive user interfaces.



The **Lead SaaS Product Designer** will be responsible for designing user experiences and platform interfaces, as well as positively impacting the design strategy for the Seamless.AI product portfolio. Effective and highly functional, yet beautiful design is critical for the success of the product, and this position will play a critical role in the expansion and maturation of Seamless.AI. This position will work closely with the product, design, engineering, and marketing teams (among others) and will have the opportunity for further career development within the position. This position will report directly to the VP of Product and work alongside other designers, developers and product team members.

  


**Responsibilities****:**
-------------------------


* Lead the UX/UI design process from concept to execution, ensuring a seamless user experience across all stages of the product life cycle.
* Conduct / support user research, testing, and analysis to gather insights on user needs, behaviors, and expectations.
* Refine and optimize the onboarding experience to increase user setup, adoption and engagement
* Improve the design of our search engine and sales product portfolio to be intuitive and easy-to-use.
* Work closely with product managers, developers, and other stakeholders to translate business goals into elegant, user-centric solutions.
* Develop and maintain a product design system and standards, ensuring consistency across all product interfaces.
* Review and analyze user and stakeholder feedback to iterate and evolve design solutions.

**Key Tasks****:**
------------------


* Act as a design and user experience subject matter expert
* Design and present digital mock-ups and clickable prototypes (non-code) of UI / UX solutions
* Work closely with product team to solve complex product and workflow challenges using UI and UX design
* Analyze user onboarding, engagement and retention data to improve the overall product experiences.
* Research and implement best practices for SaaS product design into the Seamless.AI product
* Work collaboratively with other designers within the Seamless.AI team
* Conduct / support user research and testing to develop insights related to UX and/or UI design concepts
* Partner with developers to ensure designs are carried out to specifications
* Work iteratively through designs based on internal and external stakeholder feedback
* Support design and maintenance of a comprehensive design system that will be used as a framework for all product and application design
* Hold reviews and present work to cross-functional teams, providing explanations and reasoning behind design and workflow decisions
* Deliver work timely and in accordance with estimates

**Skillset:**
-------------


* 6+ years in software design or digital product design
* 4+ years in SaaS across at least 2 distinct products or applications
* 6+ years experience working with digital design tools, such as Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.
* Proven experience solving complex UX/UI problems that resulted in a positive business outcome
* Experience using various design methodologies
* Experience working with Product Experience and Analytics tools, such as Hotjar, Fullstory, Amplitude or similar technologies
* Experience in designing information architecture and user experience for software products
* Experience working with digital prototyping tools, such as Figma, Invision, Adobe XD, etc.
* Experience designing mobile applications is a plus
* Strong written and verbal skills
* 2+ years experience working in a remote team environment
* Extreme attention to detail
* Ability to work collaboratively with others
* Comfortable providing and receiving constructive feedback and making adjustments based on feedback
* Prior experience working with start-ups or early stage companies is preferred
* Proficiency in CSS UX/UI Design Principles
* Understanding of HTML and CSS capabilities as it relates to design
* Bachelor's Degree in Design, Marketing, Business, or design certification, is strongly preferred

### **Check out what our employees think about working at Seamless:****CLICK HERE**


Seamless.AI has been delivering the world's best sales leads since 2015. Our product is the first real time, B2B search engine helping sales teams maximize revenue, increase sales, and easily acquire their total addressable market using artificial intelligence. Our product has been recognized by G2 in 2024 in the following categories: Best Software Products Overall, Best Software Products for Small Business, and Highest Satisfaction Products. We have been recognized as one of Ohio's fastest growing companies and won 2020 Best Places to Work, LinkedIn's Top 50 Tech Startups in 2020,2022, and 2023, Purpose Jobs 2023 Best Workplace Culture and Best Work-life balance, and Purpose Jobs best place to work in 2024. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Visa Sponsorship is not included in our hiring package. Applicants will need to be authorized to work in the U.S.

title: Remote UI/UX Designer
description:
Are you on the hunt for exciting new challenges that boost your professional growth? If you’re an innovator by nature and a **UX/UI Designer** by trade, we’d love to hear from you! Read on to see if you’d be a good fit for the Scopic team of 250+ professionals from over 60 countries.



At Scopic, the virtual world is our home so this is a **part-time** remote position. Only apply if you’re prepared for the zero-hour commute and the thought of collaborating with colleagues from around the globe excites you!

  


**What your day-to-day will look like:**

* Design beautiful, thoughtful, and scalable interfaces for consumer and enterprise products
* Define, communicate, and get buy-in on UI/UX best practices with stakeholders across Engineering and Product
* Evolve high-level visual concepts into pixel-perfect designs (with whiteboarding and mock-ups in between!)
* Be the user-advocate, while working to align stakeholder goals and product requirements
* Gather key insights through data and user analysis to find users' unmet & unspoken needs
* Document UI/UX requirements and interactions to assist Product for development, training, and sales purposes
* Work closely with Product and Engineering to help build, test, and evaluate designs from idea to release
* Assist with training stakeholders during the Product roll-out process, providing support during the early stages of the launch

  


**The skills and traits we’re looking for:**


* Minimum 3+ years of Product UI/UX experience designing consumer and enterprise products
* Must have proven experience as a UI designer with strong visual design skills and the ability to create design systems
* Solid experience with responsive web and desktop applications
* Strong understanding of UX design, knowledge of UX best practices, and the ability to create wireframes, user journeys and prototypes
* Proficient with industry standard tools (i.e., Figma, Sketch, Invision, Adobe Creative Suite)
* Ability to create high fidelity designs for hand-off and collaboration with developers
* Self-sufficient, able to manage projects in a fast-paced, continuous delivery environment
* Takes initiative, team player, thoughtful, and action-and-results oriented
* Strong communication, documentation, organization, and prioritization skills
* High command of verbal and written English with good communication and reporting skills
* Flexibility to work extended hours/weekends as needed
* Experience with illustrative design and 2D/3D modelling will be a bonus


**Important! Please remember to provide examples or portfolio of work with your application.**

  


**The secret ingredients that make us special:**


* Your growth is our growth. We invest in your future with paid training and other professional opportunities.
* We’re industry innovators at the forefront of change. Equipped with the latest technologies and a team of knowledgeable colleagues by your side, you’ll embrace new and interesting challenges.
* Your location. Your schedule — Pick your time-zone, choose your preferred hours, and work from the place where you feel most at home.
* Flexibility and freedom are in our DNA! As long as you have a stable internet connection and the drive to thrive, you can travel and work from anywhere you like.
* A workload you can rely on. We’ll set you enough tasks to keep that mind busy! At Scopic, we’ll ensure you always have a consistent flow of engaging, challenging work to do.
* Recognition and reward. We acknowledge diligence and hard work through annual pay increases for good performance.

  


**Down to business!**


* **Rate Range:** Negotiable depending on your skills, experience and your performance during our recruiting process.
* This is a part-time position.
* Direct communication with the client may be needed.

  


**Our values:**



Scopic offers equal opportunity. We value diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, marital status, national origin, gender, veteran status, sexual orientation, age, or disability status.



Have the skills, the drive, and the passion to join the Scopic family?



Apply today to join our growing team of remote professionals from around the world.

  


**Attention Job Seekers**: Please be aware that scammers may be fraudulently using our company's name in hiring scams. To ensure your safety, all legitimate communication regarding job opportunities from our company will only come from email addresses ending with **@scopicsoftware.com or @scopicsoftware.hire.trakstar.com**. Please exercise caution and report any suspicious activity to our official channels.

title: UX Interactive Design Lead
description:
**\\*\\*Portfolio required\\*\\***

**USC/CG Only**

We are looking for an experienced, process-minded designer that can work independently and help set UX direction on cross-functional product teams. An ideal candidate for this contract excels in design thinking, cross-functional collaboration, and possesses a firm understanding of industry best practices in native mobile and mobile-first web experiences. They are organized, self-driven, and invested in mentoring and guiding the junior designers on their product teams. Previous experience in eCommerce / working in a Lead Product Designer capacity is a huge plus!

Responsibilities

o Works well with cross-disciplinary teams, including FEWD, to create functional and engaging product experiences

o Creates rapid prototypes to validate design concepts

o Collaborates with Project Owners and Business Analysts to build and maintain a product backlog

o Works closely with partners on the crafting of requirements and user stories.

o Understands and considers business goals into their design decisions/solutions.

Qualifications

· Leads are the cornerstones of the team and act as resources, mentors, and role models for more junior members. Leads set the example for how to be “present” in a remote work environment. Leads take an active interest in the development of their teammates and make themselves available as a resource for feedback, guidance, and support for the rest of the team.

· Accountability: Leads take responsibility for the team’s ability to deliver quality work on time.

Required Experience

Both visual and interaction design (UX and UI, this is a must.)

title: UI/UX Director
description:
Aravo was founded in 2000 to bring order to the complex, chaotic world of enterprise Third Party Risk Management. We deliver the market-leading enterprise SaaS solution for managing third-party risk and compliance, helping Global 2000 companies protect their brand, build customer trust, and drive principled performance. Our notable and growing customer base includes the biggest and most respected brands in the world including Google, Microsoft, Salesforce, Deloitte, Ford, Pfizer, Visa, British Petroleum, Nike, P&G, Unilever and many others.


Working for Aravo is working with purpose. Our team takes pride in delivering excellent products that really make a difference and we enjoy providing exceptional service to our clients. We’re intelligent, collaborative and solutions driven. We know what we do helps serve a greater purpose by providing solutions that help eradicate corruption and social injustice from the world’s supply chains and third-party networks. We feel really good about that.


Aravo is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices and partners across the US, Europe and Asia.

**The Role:**


Aravo is growing fast and recognizes the importance of building a world-class team to fuel our continued success. With significant investment and strong leadership to expand our business, it’s a tremendous time to be joining the Aravo team. In this role you’ll have the opportunity to:

* Support our clients who are building and managing world-class third party risk management programs by maximizing the value of their investment in the Aravo platform.
* Provide a valued voice, where ideas and creative approaches are welcomed.
* Feel a sense of accomplishment as you are empowered to deliver in a dynamic, fun and fast-paced environment.
* Celebrate successes and grow with us!

  



What you’ll do:


* Own User Experience, User Interface and Look and Feel of all Aravo products
* Build and direct a team of designers for enterprise and mid-market offerings
* Develop and execute a strategy for a developing, managing and enforcing a design system, along with design conventions, standards, and patterns
* Deeply understand and appreciate the path each user persona takes through the Aravo system to achieve their business goals
* Work with stakeholders to define user personas and own the user experience for those personas, ensuring that those experiences are efficient, valuable, and enjoyable
* Own UI/UX roadmap for input into wider Platform/Product roadmaps
* Work with Platform and Application Product Managers to define priorities on UI transformation
* Provide a roadmap and strategy for instrumentation of the system for determination of utilization metrics
* Be a vocal advocate for design influence and priorities on behalf of our customers
* Understand the importance of using data and metrics in product design
* Responsibility for maximizing design's impact by collaborating with teams across the company, especially Product and Engineering
* Stay current and keep a pulse on what is happening in the design world
* Own Aravo’s WCAG Accessibility roadmap and strategy, working with Product Managers, Engineering and QA to execute

**Requirements**


What you’ll need:


* 8+ years of design experience for a web-based SaaS product
* 3+ years of experience leading a team of designers of various levels
* Experience in UX design with extremely diverse user populations (filling out a form vs. watching a work queue for review/approval vs. building and running reports/analytics vs. overall program management)
* Experience with B2B SaaS products, preferably with highly configurable solutions such as low-code/no-code solutions
* Experience with Reporting and Analytics
* Experience in building, growing, and mentoring design and user research teams
* Expertise in conducting various user research methodologies and the ability to translate research insights into actionable design improvements
* Deep experience with A/B testing and analytics
* Experience with path analysis and mapping to user personas and use cases
* Be a leader and a doer with a strong voice, comfortable leading a team, but also being a hands-on contributor to designs
* Thoughts on how AI tools can be used to enhance UX and UI
* Experience with WCAG (nice to have)

**Benefits**

* 100% Employer Paid Medical Insurance options for the Employee and Family
* Paid Maternity and Paternity Leave
* Life and AD&D Insurance
* Long-Term Disability Insurance
* 401K with Company Matching
* Equity Participation
* 4 Weeks of Vacation
* Fully Stocked Kitchens
* Company-Sponsored Charitable Day of Giving Events
* ......and many more!

**Aravo Solutions Inc. is registered as an employer in many, but not all, states. If an applicant is not in or able to work from a state where Aravo Solutions Inc. is registered, they may not be eligible for employment. The eligible states include: FL, GA, MA, MO, NC, NH, NJ, NV, OR, PA, SC, TN, TX, AND WA.**

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
**Job Title:** UI/UX Designer

**Department:** Design

**Location:** Remote

**Reports To:** Lead UI/UX Designer or Design Director

**Overview**

Ethics Professionals Game Corporation is looking for a UI/UX designer to join our team and create engaging and user-friendly interfaces for our games. As a UI/UX designer, you will be responsible for researching user needs, designing intuitive visuals, and working closely with cross-functional teams to bring your designs to life. If you have a passion for creating exceptional user experiences and have the skills to bring innovative designs to life, we invite you to apply!

**Responsibilities**

* **Conceptualization and Design:** Create wireframes, mockups, and prototypes to effectively communicate design ideas and visualize user flows.
* **User-Centric Focus:** Conduct user research, gather feedback, and analyze data to inform design decisions, ensuring our games are designed with the player experience in mind.
* **Collaboration:** Work closely with product managers, developers, artists, and other stakeholders to understand requirements, ensure design feasibility, and maintain consistency throughout the development process.
* **Iterative Approach:** Iterate on designs based on user feedback and usability testing, constantly striving to improve the overall experience.
* **Industry Awareness:** Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in UI/UX design.
* **Documentation:** Contribute to the creation and maintenance of UI/UX design guidelines and documentation.

**Qualifications**

* **Experience:** Proven experience as a User Interface Designer or similar role, with a focus on game UI/UX being a strong plus.
* **Design Proficiency:** Demonstrated proficiency in design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator), Figma, Sketch, or similar.
* **Technical Skills:** Solid understanding of HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript. Familiarity with prototyping tools (e.g., UXPin, Axure) is a plus.
* **Agile Methodology:** Experience working in an Agile environment and understanding of the software development lifecycle (SDLC).
* **Visual Excellence:** Exceptional visual design skills with a keen eye for detail and aesthetics.
* **Team Player:** Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a team environment.
* **Communication:** Strong communication skills to effectively present and articulate design concepts.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Experience with front-end frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, Vue.js).
* Knowledge of Unreal Engine or other game development platforms.

**To Apply**

If you're passionate about games and creating exceptional user experiences, please send your resume, portfolio demonstrating your UI/UX game design work, and a brief cover letter to ethicsprofessionals@progameco.us. We look forward to hearing from you!

**Ethics Professionals Game Corporation is an equal opportunity employer that celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment.**

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
Are you passionate about making a difference in people's lives? Do you enjoy working in a service-oriented industry? If so, this opportunity may be the right fit for you!
Modivcare is looking for an experienced UX/UI Designer. In this role, you will help establish the user experience by designing digital features and products for Modivcare. You will work with other UX/UI Designers, Delivery teams, and team members to help guide the company in accomplishing the vision for a bold and cohesive user experience across all products. You will report to a Director or Manager of Software Engineering.*Please note this is an "Evergreen" position which is used to build our candidate pool but is not a role that is open at this time. That said, we encourage you to apply to be a part of our talent community. By having your information on file, we can reach out to you when this (or a similar role) officially opens.*
You will...* Implement creative design deliverables for web-based and mobile platforms. Designs will address aspects of high-level interaction, navigation, and organization across one or more assigned platforms to satisfy user goals and improve engagement.
* Handoff designs to your Delivery Team(s), including such formats as wireframes, mock-ups, functional demos, presentations, and annotated specifications.
* Work with your Product Owner to conduct user research efforts, including: surveys, usability studies, design thinking sessions, and competitive research.
* Present research findings and design work to peers, partners, and executives for review and feedback, explaining how design solution answers user needs, business goals, technical constraints, and other project facets.
* Revise and iterate designs and documentation based on continued user testing and feedback.
* Enforce UX/UI design consistency across platforms.


We are interested in speaking with individuals with the following...* Bachelor's degree, certificate from a UX/UI program, or equivalent experience.
* 3+ years of experience as a user experience designer, interaction designer, information architect, visual designer, or similar UX/UI-related role.
* Experience with the following:
	+ Figma
	+ Zeplin
	+ Adobe Creative Cloud
* Knowledge of eCommerce, mobile app, industry trends, and competitor innovations.
* Can work with geographically distributed teams.
* Can present and "sell" creative ideas to influence decisions.
* Knowledge of inclusive design principles, accessibility standards, and general design best practices.
* Can provide a portfolio/work examples that highlight design process.


Salary: 56,200.00 - 77,300.00

title: DOR Website Lead (Web & UI/UX Specialist 3)
description:
JOB
  
The Department of Revenue's Customer Experience and Communication (CEC) Division is a team of creative collaborators and idea generators who are excited to come to work every day and make a difference. If you can think quickly on your feet, have a real passion for design, and want to grow the brand of a customer-centric organization, then this Website Lead (Web & UI/UX Specialist 3) position is for you!This position supports the vision and mission, as well as our customer experience goal to "Build relationships. Empower Success."Candidate screening will begin as early as March 8, 2024, and the hiring authority may exercise the option to make a hiring decision at any time after. It will be to the applicant's advantage to submit materials as soon as possible. Revenue is a dynamic learning organization where you will experience a remarkable work-life balance, with amazing leadership and talented co-workers ready and focused to achieve the agency's goals. We value diverse perspectives and life experiences. We employ and serve people of all backgrounds including people of color, immigrants, refugees, LGBTQ+, people with disabilities, and veterans. This unique culture of respect promotes a professional family of cohesive groups maximizing potential through opportunity. We offer a generous benefits package that includes defined benefit retirement plans; health, dental and vision coverage, deferred compensation plans, and as a public service employee, you may also be eligible for student loan forgiveness. Visit dor.wa.gov/careers to watch our recruitment video to find out more about our agency and see what our employees say about why Revenue is a great place to work. Please review the opportunity details below and forward this message to others you feel may be qualified.
  
  

EXAMPLE OF DUTIES
  
The Website Lead performs technical and analytical work at the senior level, including planning for, developing, and supporting our agency websites and applications. The goal of this position is to ensure that all taxpayers, businesses, and stakeholders can interact with the DOR website and access the information they need and complete tasks quickly.Some of the duties for this position include: Manages content in our content management system (Drupal) and optimizes search engine results.Works with website support vendor and designers to create needed content types and functionality for multiple agency websites. Troubleshoots issues with functionality and design.Drives efforts toward meeting standards for usability and accessibility, language access, and user-centered design principles for our mobile and desktop users.Uses data to make decisions on website use.Leads validation process for platform and security patches and updates.Serves as project manager for several significant and critical annual update projects.Provides training and mentoring to new staff.Reviews and publishes content prepared by others.
  
  

SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION
  
The Human Resource Division may use referrals from this recruitment to help fill future similar vacancies for up to six months. Prior to a new hire, a background check including criminal record history will be conducted. Information from the background check will not necessarily preclude employment but will be considered in determining the applicant's suitability and competence to perform in the position. This position may be covered by a collective bargaining agreement between the Department of Revenue and the Washington Public Employees Association (WPEA).The Department of Revenue is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and offer a respectful, inclusive culture for people with disabilities, as well as members of all protected groups and statuses. We encourage you to apply. If you need help during the application process, please call the Human Resources Office at 360-704-5731. Applicants who are deaf or hard of hearing may call through the Washington Relay Service by dialing 7-1-1 or 1-800-833-6388.

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Our UX/UI Designer is responsible for designing, wireframing, analyzing, and researching with the goal of creating intuitive designs and user flows and solving design problems. They will also be involved in optimizing experiences for our client projects, internal projects, and operations.

This is a client facing role.

This is a fully remote position.

**What you’ll do:**

* You’ll work on client and internal projects doing UX/UI prototypes of full websites, webapps, and mobile apps
* You’ll perform research and analysis on existing websites, webapps, and mobile apps using a combination of tools such as analytics, heat mapping, and research
* You’ll work with our other designers, our web consultants, copywriters, and developers
* You’ll be involved in the quality review process to ensure things are implemented correctly and are high quality
* You’ll interface directly with clients to get direct information for some projects
* You’ll work in design tools like:
* Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.
* Prototyping tools like Figma, Invision, Moqups, etc.
* Analysis tools like Google Analytics, HotJar, Moz
* We have clients in many industries so you’ll get to work on many different projects, styles, and brands.
* You’ll work on our operational experiences optimizing the way our customers consume our services

**Requirements:**

* Must have 3+ years of UX/UI Experience in agency, company, or high level freelance experience
* Team player who cares about their work as much as we do
* Client facing experience; Comfortable with clients
* Bachelor’s degree in related field
* Good analytical and problem-solving skills and the ability to function well in a self-directed, team-oriented environment.
* Must have experience using graphic, prototyping, and analysis tools
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Be able to help/assist in Digital Graphic design as well
* Candidates must have a strong portfolio which demonstrates the elements above.

**Nice to Haves:**

* Digital Graphic design experience
* Motion/Animation design experience

**About Us:**

Applied Imagination is a web and mobile consulting, design, and development agency based in Atlanta, Georgia. Our clients and projects span across multiple industries, purposes, and technologies. No two projects are alike, and we like that!

Our team was founded on a love of technology and the web. We’re a team of builders and problem solvers, looking for like-minded people. So, if you’re creative, driven to learn new things, and love solving problems, this is the place for you!

What Applied Imagination Offers

* Healthcare package
* 401k
* Advancement opportunities
* Paid time off + paid holidays
* Fun, casual environment

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote
