title: UX/UI Designer
description:
**About Command|Link**


Command|Link is a global SaaS Platform providing network, voice services, and IT security solutions, helping corporations consolidate their core infrastructure into a single vendor and layering on a proprietary single pane of glass platform. Command|Link has revolutionized the IT industry by tackling the problems our competitors create. In recognition for our unprecedented innovation and dedication, Command|Link was recognized as the SD-WAN Product of the Year, ITSM Visionary Spotlight, UCaaS Product of the Year, NaaS Product of the Year, Supplier of the Year, and the AT&T Strategic Growth Partner. Command|Link has built the only IT platform for scale that solves ISP vendor sprawl and IT headaches. We make it easy for our customers to get more done, maximize uptime and improve the bottom line.  

Learn more about us here!**About your new role:**


CommandLink is seeking an exceptional UX/UI Designer who thrives on transforming user experiences into captivating digital journeys. Your role is pivotal in crafting seamless interactions across diverse digital platforms. You'll be the creative force behind our user-centric design approach, collaborating closely with multifaceted teams to deliver cutting-edge solutions that resonate with our audience. **This is a Full-Time, 100% Remote opportunity.****Key Responsibilities:**

* Dive deep into user research, distilling insights into actionable design strategies that drive engagement and satisfaction.
* Conceptualize and materialize design ideas through meticulous wireframes, dynamic prototypes, and polished high-fidelity mockups.
* Foster collaboration with stakeholders, ensuring alignment between project objectives and user expectations.
* Develop comprehensive user journey maps, personas, and robust usability testing scenarios to inform design decisions.
* Embrace an iterative design process, refining and optimizing user experiences based on feedback, analytics, and emerging trends.
* Champion consistency and coherence across all platforms and devices, elevating our brand presence and usability standards.
* Forge strong partnerships with developers, translating design visions into feasible, pixel-perfect implementations.
* Remain at the forefront of UX/UI design trends and methodologies, infusing fresh perspectives into our design ecosystem.

**What you'll need for success:**

* Demonstrate a distinguished track record as a seasoned UX/UI Designer, showcasing your prowess in delivering impactful design solutions.
* Experience with Front-End Development languages (HTML, CSS, Javascript), enabling seamless collaboration with cross-functional development teams.
* Proficiency in leading design and prototyping tools such as Lucid, Sketch, Figma, Adobe XD, or equivalent platforms.
* Possess a profound grasp of user-centered design principles and methodologies, with a knack for transforming insights into intuitive interfaces.
* Communicate with clarity and finesse, fostering harmonious collaboration across diverse teams and disciplines.
* Showcase a robust portfolio that reflects the breadth and depth of your UX/UI design expertise, highlighting tangible results and user-centric innovations.

**Why you'll love life at Command|Link**  

Join us at CommandLink, where you'll have the opportunity to shape the future of business communication. We value the innovative spirit and seek individuals ready to bring their unique vision and expertise to a team that values bold ideas and strategic thinking. Are you ready to make an impact?* Room to grow at a high-growth company
* An environment that celebrates ideas and innovation
* Your work will have a tangible impact
* Generous Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage for full-time employees
* Flexible time off
* 401k to help you save for the future
* Fun events at cool locations
* Free DoorDash lunches on Fridays
* Employee referral bonuses to encourage the addition of great new people to the team

title: Senior Content Designer, PEP-C Enablement
description:
Remote, United States
Design
Netflix is seeking an experienced content designer to work on enterprise tools.  

About our Enterprise Teams
Enterprise teams design the B2B tools that our business needs to thrive and enable the member experience. Our teams work with internal stakeholders, external developers and partners integrating with Netflix platforms, and content creators helping to produce the next big hit. As a content designer in the enterprise space, you’ll join a team of stunning designers dedicated to supporting our diverse user base. These teams are at the heart of Netflix’s journey to develop the world’s most modern, creative and innovative streaming experience.  

About the Role
This role will focus on our partnership enablement tools, helping partners integrate with Netflix. This is a unique role at the intersection of storytelling, technology, and business. As an enterprise content designer, you’ll help set and elevate the Content Design vision and strategy, codify terminology, define copy style and patterns, and craft UI copy for a diverse audience. You’ll also create best practices and guidelines that scale.  

The ideal candidate will have experience in content design/content strategy, UX writing, and technical writing, with the ability to multitask while working in a fast-paced, ever-evolving environment. They’ll be self-motivated, proactive, highly organized, and have a steadfast attention to detail. They’ll work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to ingest and synthesize complex technical information. They’ll also be able to prioritize their work, communicate effectively, and represent their work to key stakeholders.**About You**
-------------

* You’re a storyteller at heart who can craft and orchestrate cohesive narratives across touchpoints, both in the product and in training and business settings.
* You’re a systems thinker who’s familiar with the development of information architecture, language frameworks, and design systems.
* You’re comfortable working with technical partners to ingest and synthesize highly complex information, turning technical jargon into user-friendly content that is consistent and legible for the various B2B audiences (e.g. producers, legal, game developers, sales executives, etc.)
* You’re a product thinker who’s comfortable with innovating and finding creative solutions.
* You’re able to drive alignment and prioritization, while partnering with cross-functional peers across design, engineering and product, to define a strong UX for a specific audience.
* You possess a keen sense of empathy for B2B audiences and a deep desire to mine opportunities in the space.
* You communicate productively with visual thinkers and are comfortable advocating for your point of view in a candid, feedback-driven culture.
**Qualifications**
------------------

* 6+ years of relevant writing experience: UX writing, content design, technical writing, taxonomy, and information architecture.
* Demonstrated experience synthesizing business requirements and technical logic into UI content for enterprise tooling and applications.
* Mastery of AP style and the confidence to know when to break the rules.
* Ability to think critically about user journeys and content flows, and to connect the dots between them.
* Ability to navigate ambiguity and traverse altitudes from strategic visioning to tactical execution.
* Highly collaborative, organized and self-directed, able to effectively prioritize and respond accordingly to the shifting needs of the team.

This full-time, salaried position reports to the partnership enablement Content Design Manager.  

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds more substantial teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.  

At Netflix, we carefully consider a wide range of compensation factors to determine your personal top of market. We rely on market indicators to determine compensation and consider your specific job, skills, and experience to get it right. These considerations can cause your compensation to vary and will also be dependent on your location.  

The overall market range for roles in this area of Netflix is typically $120,000-515,00.  

This market range is based on total compensation (vs. only base salary), which is in line with our compensation philosophy. Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here.

title: Software Engineer III - ServiceNow
description:
**Work Schedule** **:**

This is a full-time, 100% remote position, scheduled to work Monday through Friday with core hours between 8:00 am - 5:00 pm. Applicants hired into this position can work from most states. This will be discussed during the interview process.


**Be part of something remarkable**

Unleash your technical expertise at Wisconsin's #1 hospital as a **Software Engineer III-ServiceNow:** We are seeking a ServiceNow Software Engineer III to join our team at UW Health, where our commitment to impactful work is matched only by our belief in creating an enjoyable work environment. In this essential role, you will leverage your comprehensive ServiceNow platform experience to design and implement applications critical to both our clinical and business operations. Your efforts will streamline complex clinical and business processes, making them straightforward and efficient. Join us in a role where you use your talent for making technology approachable improves our services, and your workday is as fulfilling as it is fun.


As a valued member of our dynamic organization, you will have the opportunity to:


* Design and develop advanced ServiceNow solutions, leveraging a range of platform capabilities, including Employee Center Pro, ITSM, SPM, ITOM, App Engine, and beyond.
* Lead and contribute to the integration of ServiceNow with other enterprise systems, enhancing our operational capabilities.
* Help establish ServiceNow development standards, by adopting and advocating for best practices in coding, security, and platform architecture.
* Serve as a key player in the ServiceNow development team, fostering a culture of continuous learning, technical advancement, and collaborative growth.
* Engage with stakeholders to develop and maintain scalable and sustainable ServiceNow solutions.
* Address and resolve technical issues, focusing on optimizing application performance and ensuring robust security.

Join us and be part of a team that revolutionizes healthcare technology! At our premier hospital, your technical expertise will thrive at the forefront of innovation.


**At UW Health, you will have** :


* An excellent benefits package, including health and dental insurance, paid time off, two-week paid parental leave, adoption assistance and retirement plans.
* Options for a variety of schedules and shifts that offer flexibility and allow for work-life balance.
* Access to UW Health’s Wellness Options at Work that support employee/family well-being.
* Tuition benefits eligibility - UW Health invests in your professional growth by helping pay for coursework associated with career advancement.

**Education** **:**

Minimum –


* Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or related field
* Four (4) years of relevant experience may be considered in lieu of degree

Preferred – Master’s or Doctorate degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or related field


**Work Experience** **:**

Minimum –


* Demonstrated success designing and writing software multiple modern high-level programming language
* Demonstrated success developing applications within the ServiceNow platform that use client and server scripting, inbound and/or outbound REST integrations
* Demonstrated success developing and implementing custom Flow Designer actions and subflows
* Demonstrated success designing software using modern application development technologies, methodologies, and frameworks
* Demonstrated success using modern API and other application integration technologies
* Demonstrated success leading in an environment utilizing professional software engineering practices such as coding standards, code reviews, source control management
* Demonstrated success designing DevOps capabilities such as automated build, testing, continuous integration, and continuous deployment processes
* Demonstrated success leading and mentoring in the field of software engineering
* Demonstrated success managing and executing large scale projects

Preferred –


* Seven (7) years of professional software engineering experience including design, development, testing, and release
* Experience developing custom sites, pages, and widgets for the Service Portal and/or Employee Center
* Experience creating Performance Analytics collectors, indicators, sources, and dashboards
* Experience developing custom workspaces and/or UI components
* Experience performing web application planning, development, implementation, and oversight in a complex environment
* Experience designing and implementing secure application architecture
* Experience developing software within the healthcare industry
* Experience developing, deploying, and supporting applications in a 24x7x365 environment
* Experience implementing and performing web development workflows, implementation processes, and best practices for managing websites and other interactive media

**Licenses and Certifications** **:**

Minimum – None


Preferred –


* ServiceNow Administrator, Developer, or related certifications
* Professional Scrum Master, Developer, Product Owner, or related certifications
* Microsoft Azure or AWS Administrator, Developer, Architect, or related certifications
* Epic certifications
* ITIL Foundation or related certifications
* PMP

**Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion**

UW Health is committed to being a diverse, inclusive and anti-racist workplace and is an Equal Employment Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer. Our integrity shines through in patient care interactions and our daily work practices as we work to embrace the knowledge, unique perspectives and qualities each employee and faculty member brings to work each day. Applications from Black, Indigenous and People of Color (BIPOC) individuals, LGBTQ+ and non-binary identities, women, persons with disabilities, military service members and veterans are strongly encouraged. EOE, including disability/veterans

  



UW Hospital and Clinics benefits

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
**Sr. UI/UX Designer**  

**AccessHope Remote**  

At AccessHope, we’re Fighting cancer with everything we know™ by putting the ever-growing body of cancer knowledge to work for the greater good. Through a revolutionary employer health benefit offering, we remotely connect employees with cancer support services from National Cancer Institute (NCI)–Designated Comprehensive Cancer Centers. Instead of requiring those who have been diagnosed with cancer to come to the centers for renowned cancer expertise, AccessHope brings their support to the patient and their local oncologist—wherever they’re located—to improve care, outcomes, and value.  

  

Hopeful for those we support, rebellious in our approach, and collaborative by breaking down barriers, AccessHope is seeking a Senior UI/UX Designer to help us uniquely deploy the latest cancer knowledge to the places it’s needed most. As an ideal candidate, you’ll be responsible for driving our consumer digital platform's design and user experience, ensuring that it is visually appealing, user-friendly, and highly functional. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including product managers, developers, and stakeholders, to create seamless and engaging experiences for our users.  

  

**Key responsibilities**
* Lead and manage the design process, from ideation and conceptualization to implementation and iteration.
* Collaborate with product managers, developers, and stakeholders to define and implement innovative solutions for product direction, visuals, and user experience.
* Develop wireframes, prototypes, user flows, and mockups to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas.
* Conduct user research and evaluate user feedback to continuously improve and optimize user experience.
* Establish and promote design guidelines, best practices, and standard.
* Mentor and guide junior designers, fostering a culture of creativity and collaboration within the design team.
* Stay up to date with the latest UI/UX trends, techniques, and technologies to ensure our platform remains competitive.

**Required qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree in related field; 4 years of experience plus min 5+ years UI/UX experience may substitute for minimum education requirements
* 5+ years of professional experience in UI/UX design, preferably within the tech, healthcare, banking, gaming industry, or similar industry

**Preferred qualifications**
* Masters’ degree
* AGILE, PMP, Six Sigma, or similar certification
* Experience with AI-driven solutions Passion for accessible design and knowledge of WCAG 2.1, Section 508 and American Disabilities Act.

**Additional Information**
* As a condition of employment, AccessHope requires staff to comply with all state and federal vaccination mandates.
* The estimated pay scale represents the typical salary range AccessHope reasonably expects to pay for this position, with offers determined based on several factors which may include, but not be limited to, the candidate’s experience, expertise, skills, education, job scope, training, internal equity, geography/market, etc. This pay scale applies to the current posting only.

AccessHope is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, identity, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

title: Senior Product Designer (MacOS),
description:
**PDF Expert (MacOS)**
Remote
Full-time
Europe**About the client:**
Our client's company is a pioneering force in the personal productivity space on Apple devices, having shaped the landscape since 2007. Their mission is to empower individuals and teams with innovative technology, enhancing their efficiency and creativity. They are dedicated to crafting exceptional mobile and desktop experiences for those who aspire to achieve more.


Their flagship product, PDF Expert, stands as a testament to our commitment to excellence. Recognized repeatedly as "App of the Year" and an "Apple Editor’s Choice app" in the App Store, PDF Expert is unrivaled in its category. As the leading PDF editor for Mac, it continues to set the standard for user-friendly and powerful document management.


“PDF Expert is one of my must-have iPad apps and a desktop-class PDF reader”. – MacStories.net


“I was blown away at how easy the app is to use”. – MakeUseOf


“The best app for managing, editing, and reading PDFs on your iPad”. – The Sweet Setup


As a Senior Product Designer at PDF Expert you will solve customer and business problems and provide additional product value by defining, designing, and maintaining PDF Expert on all platforms (iPadOS, iOS, and macOS), supporting our product development plans and business goals.

**What you'll do:*** Constantly challenge user experiences, user flows and interface part of the product by applying new technologies, expertise, and knowledge.
* Conduct research to develop a deep understanding of the core of a problem to be solved.
* Ideate and come up with a range of potential solutions and new possibilities for further product development.
* Provide experiments, initiatives, and product improvements calling for additional values for our customers and, therefore for the business.
* Based on CJs, design user flows and needed UI (not limited to GUI); prototypes to test and validate hypotheses.
* Provide high-fidelity design outcomes meeting accepted quality level at the team.
* Ensure customer-first and data-driven design decisions.
* Gather and analyze customers’ feedback, cases, data, and stats to learn from them and improve the product further.
* Design data-informed solutions by taking into account existing constraints, business, and customer needs.
**About you:*** You’ve proven 4+ years (or 5+ major releases made where you played a crucial part) of product design experience.
* You’ve a strong understanding of human-centered design principles, Apple’s HIG and ecosystem, and a great sense of typography, composition, and conceptual thinking.
* You excel in major design and prototyping tools.
* You’re willing to learn and adopt new skills and knowledge fast, in a suitable way for the business.
* You’re a team player and have related work experience.
* You're an easy-going and open-minded person.
**Why this role:*** Customer-centric culture. We put our customers first. It means that every employee can benefit from interacting with our customers directly. It enables us to create and deliver the best solutions for millions of our users.
* Professional growth. We are professionals at everything we do. It means we own our decisions, our work, and our results. We provide quality feedback to others and welcome feedback as an opportunity to learn and improve.
* A team of amazing people. The greatest power we have is the team. It means we care about each other, ensure transparency, and invest in everyone's success.
* Impact on our products. We aim to create valuable products. It means that we improve ourselves constantly by overcoming constraints, simplifying our processes, and improving our capacity.
* Innovative culture. We try to be innovative and creative in everything we do. It means that we expect, appreciate and value new ideas.

Sounds like a match?!  

You are very welcome to apply with the form below or just drop us a line at alona@hirey.io.  

Thanks and talk soon!:D**Let’s talk!****Send us a job or CV:**
If you are a business looking to hire a designer, feel free to schedule a chat or just drop us a line at kristina@hirey.io

title: Senior Product Designer, Analytics&BI App
description:
Remote
Full-time
US or Europe**About Metabase:**
Metabase is the easiest way for people to get insights from their data, from tiny startups who get up and running quickly to major corporations with tens of thousands of users. That's why people love us.


We bring data tools with the elegance and simplicity of consumer products to the crufty world of enterprise business intelligence. We provide an opinionated open source starting point for how companies should measure, analyze and share their data, which is used by tens of thousands of companies.


And those companies choose us because we’re more enjoyable to use. We’ve gotten here by focusing on continuously improving the product without making it harder to use, through a deep integration between design and technical work. Our designers collaborate with a product manager and engineers in teams that focus on one core area product area, to allow the space to find deeper solutions to core problems. We’re focused on "better," not "more," but at speed.


We have a special culture here that really values design, and that habitually says "no" to shipping things that aren’t above our quality bar. You’ll love it here if you want to work on design problems that will challenge your intellect, without having to compromise on the quality of what you ship.


We're hiring a number of product designers at various levels, depending on experience and qualifications.

**In this role you will be:*** Owning design projects from initial solution explorations to shipping the final, beautiful thing side-by-side with engineers.
* Developing deep understanding of our users and their problems from qualitative and quantitative data.
* Proactively finding and proposing ways to make every part of the product more joyful to use.
* Making decisions that directly impact the happiness and productivity of scores of people around the world.
**About you:*** Are able to handle enterprise-level complexity, but with the skills to deliver solutions with consumer-grade simplicity and elegance.
* Have 5+ years of experience designing Web or SaaS applications in complex or technical spaces like dev tools, data visualization, biotech, etc.
* Are curious, eager, and able to understand the technical underpinnings of a problem in service of finding elegant solutions.
* Seek solutions to root causes rather than applying UI band-aids and knobs.
* Don't allow "perfect" to be the enemy of "great," and are biased towards shipping in order to learn and deliver value.
* Know that requesting and giving feedback are the best way to up-level their work and others’.
* Are excited to work asynchronously with a global team.
**Skills and Experiences:*** Experience designing fairly technical and deep Web applications.
* Able to consistently deliver beautiful, thoughtful final designs.
* Strong ability to craft clear narratives and paint a vision that builds understanding and alignment within a team.
* Can break down complex problems into smaller parts and find ways to sequence and ship things incrementally and iteratively.
* Possess a mature design process that focuses on identifying core user problems, and exploring novel and distinct ways to solve them.
* Strong written communication skills to aid in requesting feedback, explaining explorations, and defining designs.

We're a global team (50% outside the US), fully distributed (from Thailand to California), who get things done asynchronously, with plenty of uninterrupted time, supporting each other to do the best work of our careers. We offer flexibility (define your own schedule and work from wherever you want), autonomy, and an environment that fosters growth, learning, and development. We're relentlessly user-focused and believe in building long-term value, not short-term hacks. And we raised a $30M Series B to take our approach to the next level for years to come.
Sounds like a match?  

You are very welcome to apply with the form below or just drop us a line at natalie@hirey.io.  

Thanks and talk soon!:D**Let’s talk!****Send us a job or CV:**
If you are a business looking to hire a designer, feel free to schedule a chat or just drop us a line at kristina@hirey.io

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
### **Overview:**


Two Barrels is hiring an experienced UI/UX Designer for $100,000/year. You will be a traditional company employee. This is a full time M-F position with company benefits. This is a remote position. Our main office is in Spokane WA, and we have satellite offices in Austin TX and Salt Lake City UT.



We are looking for someone who has previous experience empathizing and understanding what the end-user wants by researching and learning how the software is used and coming up with solutions that meet those needs. **This person needs to be Figma and Javascript savvy.** Someone who can excel at turning mocks into a polished functional website and help bridge the gap from UI/UX to our full-stack developers who will implement your designs. The primary responsibilities will include creating and translating UI/UX design wireframes into HTML and CSS. You may also be taking existing software pages and refreshing these with a new modern look. If you like to go the extra mile to help make software more appealing to the eye — you will fit right in. Our projects range in size from completely re-vamping an entire application, to refreshing small pieces of a bigger product.



P.S. We hate that we even have to say this, but there is a scammer out there posing to be a recruiter for this role and going as far as offering a job…please know it is not us. All communication comes from our email jobs@twobarrels.com.


### **Location:**


Remote | Spokane – Austin – SLC |
### **Duration:**


Full Time
### **Wage:**


$100,000/year
### **Responsibilities:**


* Collaborate with our full-stack teams to develop common UI components and design patterns that can be adopted and extended across product suites
* Work daily with design language and UI consistency
* Create wire frames, storyboards, user flows and site maps to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas
* Be the connection between our full-stack and design team by being fluent in HTML/CSS
* Develop innovative user interfaces and interactive models that leverage next generation web technologies to improve user productivity and operational efficiency
* Researching and deeply understanding problems so you can get to the root of what’s really important

### **Minimum Qualifications:**


* 3+ years experience in a UI/UX position
* Strong understanding of Figma and Javascript
* Understanding of HTML, and CSS
* Knowledge of design and development best practice
* Working knowledge of industry tools, such as Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Sketch, Zeplin, Adobe xD, Invision etc
* Excellent ability to manage timelines and be self-directed

### **Why you might like this job:**


If you’ve been searching for a place where you can come and make amazing software design and have a huge impact on people who use it, then this is your place! We don’t have preconceived notions about what software should be. It just has to be designed for the user. So, really, your imagination is the only limit on what you can do here.



Our company is known for staying on the forefront of our industry’s trends, and we set the bar others try to leap over. That means you get to play, experiment, and do whatever you need to make our software not only look good, but pack high-end functionality. If you’re tired of doing things the stuffy corporate way, come join us.



#BI-Remote


### **Benefits:**


* Great Wage & Success Meetings with your manager
* Work From Home comfort package & company provided equipment
* 22 days paid time off annually, PLUS 4 paid holidays
* 4% 401k employer matching through Fidelity
* 100% employer-paid medical, dental and vision for employees
* Maternity and Paternity Leave
* Flexible hours
* Coffee shop next door
* Crappy parking? Oh, I mean a cool downtown location for easy public transportation options…

title: JR Web Designer
description:
**Jr. Web Designer**

**About Ripley Entertainment Inc.**

**For over 100 years,** Ripley Entertainment Inc. has been a leader in location-based family entertainment. Built on the foundation of a daily newspaper cartoon in 1918 — still in print today — Ripley Entertainment has grown to be a world leader in family entertainment, expanding to include more than 100 attractions in 10 countries around the world. Along with Ripley’s Believe It or Not! Odditoriums, Guinness World Records Attractions, Aquariums, WaxWorks, traveling shows, and miniature golf, the world of Ripley’s continues to grow through exciting new experiences, content, and books for all ages.

  

Learn more about Ripley Entertainment by visiting Ripleys.com.

 **Job Description:**

  

We are looking for a Jr. Web Designer to join our team. This person will assist with designing, developing, and managing our online properties, including our network of websites, e-commerce sites, contest landing pages, email marketing, and business listings. The ideal candidate will have a keen eye for UX/UI design and work closely with our senior web developers, brand manager, content marketers, social media strategists, analytics manager, graphic designers, and copywriters.

  

As a Jr. Web Designer, you will work on a team with middle and senior-level colleagues, with opportunities to increase your skillset and career growth.

**Location:** Remote, United States

**Job Type:** Full-time, salary (We are not accepting contract positions)

**Responsibilities:**

* Design, develop, and assist with the management of our websites built on a headless CMS.
* Assist with creating and updating ticket types on our e-commerce sites.
* Assist in the design, development, copywriting, and deployment of external and internal email campaigns.
* Monitor and make updates to our business listings, including updating hours of operation, location descriptions, and location images.
* Create online and social media contest landing pages using our contesting platform.
* Respond to helpdesk tickets and support requests.
* Other duties as assigned.
* **A web-based portfolio must be provided for** **consideration.**

**Required skills:**


1+ years of experience of the following:

* HTML, CSS, JSON, and JavaScript
* Headless CMS like Directus, or comparable platform
* Visual Studio or comparable IDE
* Cloud hosting, such as Cloudflare or comparable platform
* Mailchimp, SendGrid, or comparable ESP platform
* Version Control System like GitHub, GitLab, or comparable system

  

Familiar or proficient in the following:

* SvelteKit UI framework
* SEO and SEM best practices
* SSL Certificates
* DNS
* Google Analytics/Google Business Manager
* Adobe Creative Suite
* Microsoft Office
* Chatmeter, or comparable reputation management platform

**Desired skills:**

* Bachelor’s degree in web design/development, or a related field
* Strong debugging and problem-solving skills
* Detail oriented, with an eye for quality.
* Ability to work with strict deadlines and tight turnaround times.
* Work in a team environment, have a flexible attitude, and ability to adapt to shifting priorities.
* Ability to manage multiple projects and collaborate with our on-site managers and other departments.
* Strong time-management
* Copywriting and copyediting skills

**Benefits:**


Ripley’s Team Members are eligible to participate in the benefits plans established by the Company, subject to the participation and eligibility requirements of those plans. Benefits offered to full time employees include:

* Medical Insurance: Choice of plans available including dental and vision coverage
* Long Term Disability and Life Insurance
* 401(k) Retirement Plan
* Vacation and Sick Leave

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
**This position is remote based.**
----------------------------------


Are you a seasoned UI/UX designer who wants a job that serves a larger purpose? Are you interested in making a meaningful, life-changing difference for millions of students? Digication is changing the way students learn from the ground up. Instead of rote learning through lectures and tests, Digication allows students to create online portfolios - collaborative and safe learning spaces - to encourage project-based learning. Campuses report that sustained ePortfolio usage leads to higher levels of student success, including significant increases in pass rates, GPA, and retention rates. Digication is now being used by students at over 7,000 K-12 and Higher Education schools.


**Some of your responsibilities**
---------------------------------


* Work closely with a CEO and CoFounder led product team across all products
* Create and maintain UI and UX that is beautiful, intuitive, responsive, and accessible (WCAG 2.1)
* Collaborate with technical team to create new features or entirely new products that use consistent visual language
* Manage large amount of UI components across hundreds of screens in an organized, efficient, and error free manner


**Your skills**
---------------


* Hands-on experience as a **UI / UX designer of at least 3 years with complex single-page applications**
* Expert level UI / UX design skills with deep understanding of user behaviors while balancing technical limitations in modern web applications
* Excellent knowledge of how modern web applications work
* Great written and verbal skills, just like every great communicator ;-)


**Our culture**
---------------


* We work remotely and employees are distributed throughout the world.
* We work as a team, with direct access to the company founders.
* We are self motivated, hold ourselves accountable for our work and commitments.
* Although we work with a sense of urgency, we don't like cutting corners.
* Integrity is more important for us then profitability (although we are profitable!).
* We are not a “work hard/play hard” startup but responsible adults with diverse backgrounds and interests who take our mission, our clients and our lives seriously.
* We value personal growth and learning over titles and salaries.


**Perks at Digication**
-----------------------


* **Work wherever you want.** If you want to move, travel, experience the world, do it while having a full time job with us.
* There is one team meeting a day and one company-wide all-hands meeting once a week. Otherwise you work at your own pace.
* We connect via Slack and Zoom, and use Figma for all design related work.
* We will get you whatever computer / phone / tablet you see fit.
* Last and not least, you get to work with on a product that makes a difference for students at thousands of schools and colleges. See what our users say about us: https://www.youtube.com/channe... (https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCiSdYblDWvWUccKA9zBIV4Q/videos)


**The Hiring Process**
----------------------


* **Application**: Provide us with the following: a cover letter, resume, link to your portfolio (please make sure you include screenshots of web applications you have designed)
* **Work Sample**: Within 48 hours of the application, we will let you know whether we would like you to work on our small work sample. This shouldn't take you longer than 2-3 hours.
* **Video interview**: Upon successful review of your work sample, we will schedule a video interview with you. This interview is intended to gauge the general cultural fit, communication, and general UI/UX design skills.
* **Group Meeting**: Get a chance to meet some more Digication peeps.
* **Job offer**: We will let you know within 5 business days from the group interview whether you will be offered the position.

title: (Remote) Software Development Manager, Mixed Reality (AR/VR/XR) iOS, VisionOS
description:
#### **Why engineering at Stryker?**


At Stryker we are dedicated to improving lives, with a passion for researching and developing new medical device products. As an engineer at Stryker, you will be proud of the work that you will be doing, using cutting-edge technologies to make healthcare better. Here, you will work in a supportive culture with other incredibly talented and intelligent people, creating industry-leading medical technology products. You will also have growth opportunities as we have a culture that supports your personal and professional development.


Need another reason to apply? **Check out these 8 reasons to join Stryker's engineering team:** **https://www.strykercareersblog.com/post/8-reasons-to-join-strykers-engineering-team**

We are proud to be named one of the World’s Best Workplaces and a Best Workplace for Diversity by Fortune Magazine! Learn more about our award-winning organization by visiting **stryker.com**


**It's an Exciting Time to Join to Stryker!****What You Will Do**
--------------------

*As a valued member of Stryker’s AI innovation unit, you will work alongside trailblazers, industry visionaries, innovators, and inventors who are committed to bringing computer vision, AI/ML and digital innovation to the operating room and other healthcare settings.*

 *You’ll contribute to fast-paced cycles of innovation and develop core technologies that power a wide array of Stryker’s solutions, including: surgical robotics and navigation, image-guided surgery, treatment selection, outcome assessment, and clinical decision intelligence. You will apply your core skills across a range of deployment platforms spanning from mobile applications, cloud services, and SDKs to embedded systems, edge devices, and mixed reality (XR) platforms. You will have an opportunity to work across a wide variety of therapeutic areas ranging from orthopaedics and neurosurgery to emergency care and operating room safety and efficiency – plus many more.*


The **Software Development Manager, Mobile iOS** will be responsible for leading a team in the design, development, and implementation of our iOS applications, as well as maintaining and optimizing existing features. This person will lead the overall software architecture and work closely with the rest of the development team, including designers and backend developers, to ensure that our apps meet the highest standards of quality and performance.


Technical Responsibilities:

* You will translate user needs to design inputs/specifications and produce advanced component and sub-system level designs.
* You will analyze and correct complex product design issues, using independent judgment.
* You will independently balance design tradeoffs while designing a component of the system.
* You will develop and design software systems per requirements and architecture defined.
* You will generate and review the necessary documents to support the project. (Requirements/Design/Architecture/Bugs/Test)
* You will lead out on development of Mobile Applications for iOS products include iPads, iPods, and iPhones.
* You will design, architect, and develop maintainable, testable, functional software that meets product and customer requirements.
* You will enforce and maintain software coding standards.
* You will analyze user needs and software requirements to determine feasibility of design within time and cost constraints.
* You will manage a team of 5 or more mobile developers.


General Responsibilities:

* You will lead and support other team members to create or improve procedures, policies, processes, systems, and technology requirements.
* You will mentor and grow technical talent within discipline/function.
* You will lead and support complex product development for cross functional teams, influencing multiple technical areas of expertise.
* You will hold the team accountable to deliver high quality results with passion, energy and drive to meet business priorities.
* You will mentor, develop and influence across the business, intentionally building divisional relationships.
* You will lead code reviews for projects/systems as independent reviewer applying design principals, coding standards and best practices.
* You will collaboratively review and update coding standards

**What You Need**
-----------------

* Bachelor's degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, related field, or equivalent experience required
* 8+ years of work experience required
* 4+ years in mobile development required
* 2+ years of experience leading/managing a team is required

**What We Would Love That You Have (Preferred Qualifications)**
---------------------------------------------------------------

* Strong experience in Swift and Objective-C
* Swift UI is a plus
* UIKit, Core Data, Core Bluetooth, AVFoundation, NSURLSession
* Experience with ARKit and RealityKit is a plus.
* Experience with Metal Framework is a plus
* Excellent debugging skills.
* Talent for cleanly architecting UI features
* Passion for quality and attention to detail
* Superior ability to identify and resolve complex problems
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to work cross-team
* Inquisitive and highly motivated self-starter
* 122,800- $271,400salary plus bonus eligible + benefits. Actual minimum and maximum may vary based on location. Individual pay is based on skills, experience, and other relevant factors.

#### **About Stryker**

**Our benefits:**

  

* 12 paid holidays annually
* Health benefits include: Medical and prescription drug insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, critical illness insurance, accident insurance, hospital indemnity insurance, personalized healthcare support, wellbeing program and tobacco cessation program.
* Financial benefits include Health Savings Account (HSA), Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs), 401(k) plan, Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP), basic life and AD&D insurance, and short-term disability insurance.

For a more detailed overview of our benefits or time off, please follow this link to learn more: US Stryker employee benefits  

  

**About Stryker**  

Stryker is a global leader in medical technologies and, together with its customers, is driven to make healthcare better. The company offers innovative products and services in MedSurg, Neurotechnology, Orthopaedics and Spine that help improve patient and healthcare outcomes. Alongside its customers around the world, Stryker impacts more than 130 million patients annually. More information is available at stryker.com.  

  

**Know someone at Stryker?**  

Be sure to have them submit you as a referral prior to applying for this position. Learn more about our employee referral program on our referral page  

  

Stryker is driven to work together with our customers to make healthcare better. Employees and new hires in sales and field roles that require access to customer accounts as a function of the job may be required, depending on customer requirements, to obtain various vaccinations as an essential function of their role.

title: UX / UI / Product Designer
description:
REMOTE
Product
Product
  
**UX / UI Designer**

**About Us**


Chess.com is one of the largest gaming sites in the world and the #1 platform for playing, learning, and enjoying chess.


We are a team of 700+ fully remote people in 60+ countries working hard to serve the global chess community. We are here to support 165 million players worldwide with the best possible product, content, and tools to serve the chess community!


We are a tech company. A gaming company. A content company. And we do it all with passion and commitment to the game. Above all we prize our mission-driven, flat, life-celebrating, no-corporate culture, and we look forward to meeting you and learning more about what you can bring to the team.

**About You**


You are a UX designer with an emphasis on clear, clean, and fun interactions. You see design as a series of neverending questions. Asking, “Do you like this? Does this accomplish your goals? Does this make your life better in some way?”


You are a true UX practitioner. A process nut. You are creative, intuitive, and always learning. You have an interest in providing a healthy way for users to escape the stress of the day.


You are a team player. You know to check your ego at the door. You would also love nothing more than to help people around the world discover the fun of chess!

**What You’ll Do**

* Create simple, clear, and fun interactions
* Take ownership in the creation of core product initiatives
* Collaborate with team members to push our product design vision further
* Delve through best practices across Gaming and SAS platforms
* Utilize Kaizen principles that continually improve products in ways that avoid change resistance
* Work with the creative team to assure consistency across platforms
* Develop a connection to a game that has been growing for 1500 years

**Requirements**

* Minimum of 5 years of experience in UX and product design, preferably in a fast-paced and agile environment
* You “get” chess
* Excellent communicator and collaborator
* Lifelong learner
* Familiarity with key UX Design software (Especially Figma)
* Familiarity with utilizing design systems (including Figma tokens)
* Ability to think through and define user flows
* Experience working directly with product and development teams do solve problems
* Familiarity with UX research + implementing designs to act on said research
* Experience designing UI user flows/forms
* consideration for the smaller details: styling inputs, error handling, hover effects, etc
* Experience crafting experiences for both web and mobile apps
* Think mobile first and how to adapt for different form factors from there
* Strong portfolio showcasing a range of user-centered design solutions and your design process.

**About the Opportunity**


This is a full-time position.


We are 100% remote (work from anywhere, but expect to maintain some overlap with core US hours)

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
**About Appriss Retail**


Appriss Retail provides real-time decisions and active risk monitoring to enable our customers to maximize profitability while managing risk. Our solutions are continually adapting to changing market conditions.


We bring 20+ years of retail data science expertise and experience. We serve a global base of leading commerce partners, representing 1/3 of all US omnichannel retail sales activity across 150,000 retail locations across specialty, apparel, department store, hard goods, big box, grocery, pharmacy, and hospitality businesses in 45 countries on six continents.


The company provides compelling, relevant, and profitable collective intelligence to operations, finance, marketing, and loss prevention. Appriss Retail’s performance-improvement solutions yield measurable results with significant return on investment.

**Overview**  

You are a talented Senior Product Designer (level commensurate with experience) experienced in designing for complex SaaS applications. Reporting to the Chief Product Officer, you will help deliver on the design and execution of our products while also collaborating with Product, Engineering, and internal and external stakeholders, to help drive the overall product vision. You thrive in delivering delightful solutions to complex, multi-dimensional problems, and enjoy every step of the design process from planning to shipping. **Responsibilities*** Lead the design strategy and execution for our products and promote platform cohesion across all products.
* Work closely with our engineering team on the design, governance, and implementation of our design system and pattern libraries.
* Create user-centered design solutions that address customer needs and drive product adoption and engagement.
* Gather insights and feedback on product design.
* Monitor usage to identify potential challenges and opportunities for design solutions.
* Monitor the success of the experience through web analytics and user feedback, identifying challenges and opportunities for design solutions.
* Stay up-to-date with emerging trends and technologies in enterprise SaaS design, sharing insights and best practices with the team on a regular basis.
* Work with Engineering teams and take the lead in setting direction on UI prototype tooling (Figma, Balsamiq, etc.).

**Qualifications*** 3 - 6 years of experience in product design, ideally at a high-growth SaaS company.
* History of shipping superb work that delivers on intended user outcomes.
* Been a key player in designing, building, and maintaining design systems for large product ecosystems.
* A systems thinking mindset when approaching your work.
* Strong leadership and execution skills, leading and executing design projects from ideation, to engineering handoff, to product launch.
* Expertise in design and prototyping tools.
* A growth mindset that is always finding ways to level up your skills and elevate the team with improved processes, tools, and insights.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with clients, teams, and stakeholders.

**Preferred Qualifications*** Experience designing for analytics platforms or large, enterprise SaaS ecosystems.
* Experience with HTML/CSS/SASS, JavaScript, Framer, and/or React to build code-based prototypes.
	+ Ability to take mockups, wireframes, and designs to production-ready responsive code in HTML, CSS/SASS for desktop, mobile, and tablet.
	+ Experience working with JavaScript, React, jQuery.
	+ Experience with ASP.NET desirable.
* Experience designing prompt-based, generative AI interfaces.


If you are a passionate and experienced product designer with a track record of designing successful enterprise SaaS products, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity to shape the future of our product line. **Physical Demands** – Sedentary. **Benefits**  

Appriss Retail offers competitive benefits including medical, dental, and vision coverage. We offer an immediate vesting 401(k) plan with employer matching, unlimited paid time off for salaried employees, and well-being support including gym reimbursements, a subscription to Calm – Meditation and Sleep app, and paid leave for new parents and family care. As a hybrid global community, we also offer a remote work-first environment empowering our people to work wherever suits their lifestyle.
The pay range for this role is:
100,000 - 150,000 USD per year (Remote - United States)

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
**UI/UX Designer**

**Who We Are**

TrueLearn is a rapidly growing ed-tech company committed to maximizing learner performance on high-stakes licensure exams. Our learning platform leverages fundamentals of cognition and data science to provide a connected experience between individual learners and their academic institutions seeking to maximize learning outcomes. We seek to be data-driven and customer-focused in all that we do. Our culture is built around authenticity, empowerment, and a shared mission to relentlessly advocate for our learners.

TrueLearn is seeking a UI/UX Designer to join the team! UI/UX Designers play a critical role in shaping the digital experiences that users interact with daily. They bridge the gap between aesthetics and functionality, ensuring that products not only look good but also provide meaningful and enjoyable experiences for users. The UI/UX Designer will be a subject matter expert in creating products that enhance a user’s experiences. This role is responsible for working with cross-functional teams to develop user-centered design solutions for all levels of products and digital initiatives using research/data to create wireframes, flows and prototypes.

**Position Summary**

The UI/UX Designer plays a crucial role in creating intuitive, visually appealing, and user-friendly digital products and interfaces. This role involves a combination of design and user research skills to ensure that products meet the needs and expectations of users while aligning with the business objectives of the company. The UI/UX Designer will be involved in setting design standards, mentoring other designers, and helping to shape the overall design strategy for a product or project.

**Responsibilities**

* Participate in user research activities such as competitive analysis, user interviews, surveys, and usability studies.
* Effectively communicate design concepts, strategy, and the rationale behind design decisions.
* Provide innovative solutions and guide others in the design process.
* Create user-centered designs by considering market & competitive analysis, customer feedback, and usability findings.
* Lead and define specifications for our products user interface and experience, ensuring that content and functionality are logically organized and intuitive for our users.
* Conduct concept and usability testing; gather and evaluate user feedback.
* Develop wireframes and interactive prototypes that outline the layout and functionality of digital interfaces, allowing for early testing, feedback and refinement of solutions.
* Collaborate with product, editorial, marketing, and engineering in an agile process.
* Ensure that digital products are accessible to all users, including those with disabilities, by adhering to accessibility standards and guidelines.
* Design interfaces that are responsive and adaptable to different screen sizes and devices.
* Keep up to date on industry trends, establish and advocate for UX/UI best practices, guidelines and standards, and emerging technologies; contribute to improvements in process and workflow.
* Maintain and contribute to product design systems.
* Participate in roadmap planning with the Product team.
* Collaborate with other designers to maintain design consistency and coherence across the product as appropriate.
* Support development, QA, and launch of products and feature iterations.

**Qualifications & Required Skills**

* A Bachelor’s degree in Design or a related field (or equivalent experience).
* 6+ years experience as a UX/UI Designer for mobile and web platforms, EdTech industry preferred.
* A strong online portfolio showcasing a range of UI/UX design projects.
* Knowledge of user research methodologies and usability principles with experience conducting user testing and interviews.
* Ability to understand and visualize complex user flows, interactions, and technical information.
* HTML and CSS knowledge and current on latest responsive design techniques.
* Familiarity with WCAG2 guidelines and implementation.
* Proficiency with Figma preferred.
* Previous experience working in an Agile environment.
* Excellent time management, communication skills (written and verbal), and team collaboration skills.
* Self-organized, detail-oriented, and self-motivated.
* Passion for identifying and solving real user problems.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $70,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Referral program
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Compensation package:

* Yearly bonus

Experience level:

* 5 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* UI/UX design: 6 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Product Designer (contract)
description:
**Product Designer (Contract)**

 *Please note that this is a contract role providing services to Microsoft through external staffing partners of Allegis Global Solutions. If you are selected for this role, you will be employed by AGS and will not be an employee of Microsoft.*

 **Summary:**


The Bing Search & Design System team is looking for a Product Designer to help bring our projects to life. This role is for someone with strong design abilities, typographic skills, digital expertise, and acute attention to detail. You are a highly motivated, self-directed team player who works well under pressure and can thrive in a deadline-driven and fast-paced environment. Development of visual design concepts referencing our visual system and interface guidelines and sharing those with the visual system designers. You are also capable of managing multiple projects simultaneously. You are a great creator, collaborator, and communicator.  



  

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Lead collaborative design for your assigned product area across designers, researchers, product managers, and developers.
* Conduct or participate in basic research to understand the behaviors, motivations, and needs of our customers and then utilize this knowledge to develop relevant and impactful experiences.
* Work closely with product teams to understand strategic planning and ensure your work aligns to business goals while creating customer value.
* Draw upon your ability to map end-to-end experiences and ideate broadly to generate creative solutions to complex user scenarios and business needs.
* Propose creative solutions to complex problems.
* Utilize your strong interaction and visual design skills to create amazing product designs.
* Document final designs in a point-of-reference/specification, adjust design systems and work directly with engineers for implementation.

 **Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in Design, Graphic Design, or related program. A combination of education and experience may substitute for a Bachelor's degree.
* 5-7+ years of visual UI design/Graphic design for website/mobile apps and work-related experience required.
* Have a good understanding of UX (user experience, web, and mobile interaction patterns). Strong visual/UI design skills.
* Ability to discuss and present an in-depth knowledge of standard design principles: color, typography, layout, brand.
* Excellent communication skills
* Ability to work under constant deadline constraints.
* Must have the ability to understand technology issues and communicate information effectively.
* Proficiency in current and emerging web technologies and standard design software packages (i.e. Figma)

Portfolio for a review with design lead.  
* 

  

**Additional Details:**

* Location: Remote
* Duration: 4 months
* Pay Range: $46.50 - 52.50 per hour

  



  

*AGS is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer (M/F/Disability/Veterans). We will consider all applications without regard to race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, genetic information or any other status protected by applicable law.*

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Our UX/UI Designer is responsible for designing, wireframing, analyzing, and researching with the goal of creating intuitive designs and user flows and solving design problems. They will also be involved in optimizing experiences for our client projects, internal projects, and operations.


This is a client facing role.


This is a fully remote position.


**What you'll do:**


* You'll work on client and internal projects doing UX/UI prototypes of full websites, webapps, and mobile apps
* You'll perform research and analysis on existing websites, webapps, and mobile apps using a combination of tools such as analytics, heat mapping, and research
* You'll work with our other designers, our web consultants, copywriters, and developers
* You'll be involved in the quality review process to ensure things are implemented correctly and are high quality
* You'll interface directly with clients to get direct information for some projects
* You'll work in design tools like:
+ Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.
+ Prototyping tools like Figma, Invision, Moqups, etc.
+ Analysis tools like Google Analytics, HotJar, Moz

* We have clients in many industries so you'll get to work on many different projects, styles, and brands.
* You'll work on our operational experiences optimizing the way our customers consume our services

**Requirements:**


* Must have 3+ years of UX/UI Experience in agency, company, or high level freelance experience
* Team player who cares about their work as much as we do
* Client facing experience; Comfortable with clients
* Bachelor's degree in related field
* Good analytical and problem-solving skills and the ability to function well in a self-directed, team-oriented environment.
* Must have experience using graphic, prototyping, and analysis tools
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Be able to help/assist in Digital Graphic design as well
* Candidates must have a strong portfolio which demonstrates the elements above.


**Nice to Haves:**


* Digital Graphic design experience
* Motion/Animation design experience


**About Us:**


Applied Imagination is a web and mobile consulting, design, and development agency based in Atlanta, Georgia. Our clients and projects span across multiple industries, purposes, and technologies. No two projects are alike, and we like that!


Our team was founded on a love of technology and the web. We're a team of builders and problem solvers, looking for like-minded people. So, if you're creative, driven to learn new things, and love solving problems, this is the place for you!


What Applied Imagination Offers


* Healthcare package
* 401k
* Advancement opportunities
* Paid time off + paid holidays
* Fun, casual environment

title: JUNIOR UX DESIGNER AND UI DEVELOPER
description:
KOA, INC. DEI STATEMENT
  
  

At KOA, we believe the outdoors is fun and for everyone. We are committed to having a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment where all are treated with dignity and respect. We strive to:
  
* intentionally create a sense of community and belonging for our guests, employees and franchise partners
* continually educate ourselves and advance our understanding about DEI
* sustain a culture that promotes diversity of thought and experiences
* ensure everyone has the ability to experience the outdoors and that our facilities are accessible to all
* drive change in our company and industry through action and implementation


ABOUT KAMPGROUNDS OF AMERICA, INC.
  
  

Kampgrounds of America, Inc. (KOA) is the world’s largest network of privately owned campgrounds and the leader in outdoor hospitality. KOA has 525+ locations across the United States and Canada including a mix of franchised and company-owned parks. KOA has approximately 90 employees at its corporate headquarters in Billings, Montana, and 1,200+ across its location. Founded in 1962, the mission of KOA is “connecting people to the outdoors and each other,” and those who represent the brand share the values of being family-oriented, enthusiastic, entrepreneurial, customer-focused and progressive.
  
  

REPORTS TO
  
Director of Product Development
  
  

POSITION SUMMARY
  
The KOA Junior UX Designer and UI Developer works closely with a team of software developers to build, customize, and integrate applications with the K2 property management system (KOA’s proprietary property management system) used by campgrounds across the nation. The job includes updating existing user interfaces and user experience concepts already in operation as well as guiding developers on best patterns and practices on UI coding and user experience fundamentals in collaboration with our Senior UX Designer and UI Developer. Junior UX Designer and UI Developers may have the opportunity to engage in all phases of the software development lifecycle which include understanding and analyzing user/business system requirements, UX design, UI development, testing and responding to support tickets and outages. This position requires that the individual have a professional attitude, be detail orientated, and be an engaged team member.
  
  

SUPERVISORY DUTIES & RELATIONSHIPS
  
Non-supervisory Position.
  
Will work closely with Senior UX Designer and UI Designer, Developers, Senior Developers, Product Owners, Business Analysts and Software Quality Analysts.
  
  

Remote work is authorized for this position up to and including full time remote work as approved by the supervisor.
  
* This position will require a minimal amount of travel. In-person attendance will be required on a yearly cycle to attend departmental meetings and/or staff development meetings. Ample advance notice will be provided.
* Attendance at all sprint ceremonies, including daily stand-up meetings, is required utilizing conferencing collaboration tools when working remote.


SPECIFIC DUTIES
  
* Collaborate with senior UX Designer/UI Developer, product owners, senior developers, and project managers to understand requirements.
* Assist Senior UX Designer and UI Developer on design activities.
* Assist in the design and development of responsive, user-friendly applications and software integrations.
* Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code in a variety of technologies.
* Troubleshoot and debug issues in existing code.
* Learn standard best practices, procedures, and standards regarding UI and UX.
* Provide user interface technical opinion and guidance during project planning.
* Optimize application UI for maximum speed, scalability, and agility.
* Maintain a consistent user experience across all applications.
* Design and develop mobile/responsive applications.
* Convert Technical Specifications into functioning program code/modules.
* Meet/exceed development project timelines.
* Evaluate new and existing features and offer suggestions for improvement.
* Participate in Agile development meetings to include Sprint Planning, Scrums, Retrospectives, and Sprint Reviews.
* Participate in code reviews to maintain code quality, identify and address issues, and promote best practices within the development team.
* This job description is not intended to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities. Other duties, responsibilities and activities may change or be assigned at any time with or without notice.


EXPECTED RESULTS
  
* Efficient and effective Agile development team that meets deadlines and focuses on providing maximum business value.
* Can-do attitude that permeates the team.
* Proactive communications utilizing excellent written and verbal communication skills.


JOB QUALIFICATIONS
  
* Technical Requirements:
* Experience with UX tools (Adobe XD, Figma, etc.) required.
* Experience with Web Design (HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, WordPress, SharePoint, etc.) required.
* Understanding of server-side CSS pre-processing (LESS, SASS) desired.
* Familiarity with Web Frameworks (Angular, React, Bootstrap, etc.) desired.
* Basic level of .NET (C#, ASP.NET, SQL Server, etc.) desired.
* Familiarity with unit testing strategies desired.
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Web Development, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
* Understanding of object-oriented programming (OOP) and MVC principles and design; familiarity with industry-standard design patterns a plus.
* Basic understanding of version control systems (e.g., Git).
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Proven team player that can work in an Agile development environment.
* Proven ability to meet deadlines and complete projects on time.
* Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and development methodologies.
* Infectious “Can-Do” attitude.
* Highly motivated individual with a passion for software development.


Kampgrounds Of America, INC. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and strives to provide an environment where all employees and applicants are treated with respect. The company is committed to fair treatment of all people. This value ensures employees and candidates are treated equally and are protected from discrimination or harassment of any kind. This includes discrimination on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, gender, gender identity, age, sexual orientation, or any other protected status.
  
  

**Benefits Offered:**  

* Medical Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance

* Flexible Spending Account
* Dependent Care Account
* Paid Life Insurance
* Paid Long Term Disability
* Voluntary Life Insurance
* Voluntary Short-Term Disability
* Voluntary Critical Illness Insurance
* Voluntary Accident Insurance
* Paid Time Off
* Paid Parental Leave
* Employee Assistance Program

* 401K Company Contributions

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
Are you someone who likes to create delightful experiences for users in challenging environments and on emerging platforms? If so, then you may be the right fit for Wildfire Systems as our next UX Designer hire!

**About the Opportunity**

We’re hiring a UX Designer to drive new innovation in customer-facing software. The right person for this role will be excited by the idea of finding new ways to engage our partners’ users through cashback, coupons and other programs. You’ll get a chance to be creative and data driven, directly adding top-line revenue to our business.

**About the Company**

Wildfire Systems is a cutting edge, omni-platform fintech service provider that offers white label rewards and loyalty programs, including cashback, coupons and related products to some of the biggest brands in the financial services industry. We’re innovative and have been awarded several patents around the products we’ve built. Plus, we’re a fun, high-performance and hard-charging team that loves working together to build a great business.

**What You’ll Need to Succeed**

The right candidate will have a minimum of three years in a UX design role working on customer-facing software for mobile and desktop platforms.

Skills that will get us excited to work with you:

* User testing
* Experience with shopping/e-commerce products and/or browser extensions
* Scrum or Agile experience
* Research and data synthesis: finding strong patterns and compelling stories in data and user testing to guide us in building better products
* Design process leadership and strong opinions about how we can make our small team more productive

**Benefits**

* Competitive salary
* Stock options
* Medical, dental & vision coverage
* Life insurance and disability
* Flexible vacation time
* Remote-first with a 100% distributed team (anywhere in the US)
* Laptop and whatever other equipment you need to be successful
* Company summits/offsites (we pay for your travel, lodging, etc.)
* Home office stipend
* 401k retirement plan

**Salary Range Disclaimer**

The base salary range represents the low and high end of the Wildfire Systems salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary and may be above or below the range based on factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Wildfire Systems’ total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include quarterly bonuses and long term incentives.

**Salary Range Transparency**

70,000 - 80,000 USD per year

Equal Opportunities and Accommodations Statement

Wildfire Systems is deeply committed to building a workplace and global community where inclusion is not only valued, but prioritized. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, family status, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, neuro-diversity, disability, age, or veteran status, or any other non-merit based or legally protected grounds.

Wildfire Systems is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in the employment application process. To request an accommodation, please contact your primary Wildfire contact (whomever you first spoke to about a position at Wildfire), or contact support at https://wildlink.me/support at least one week in advance of your interview.
